loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina continúa en el banco comunal “Señor del Calvario” y con el negocio de la molinera, ella tiene una molinera en su domicilio y también continua con sus terrenos de cultivo de trigo, maíz, entre otros productos. En esta ocasión desea invertir el crédito para comprar semillas como trigo, maíz, quinua y otros productos.
Luz Marina agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is still with the “Señor del Calvario” communal bank, and still has her milling business. She has her own mill at home and also has fields where she continues to grow wheat and corn, among other produce.

This time, she wants to invest the loan to buy seeds for wheat, corn, quinoa and other produce.

Luz Marina is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy seeds for wheat, corn, quinoa and other produce.

loans.name: Efren Flor  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Efrén Flor se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse tiempo atrás y formar este Banco Comunal que les ha servido de mucho ya que con los créditos, ellos han podido mejorar sus pequeños negocios. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Mireya, tiene 50 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad pero aún viven en su casa. Su esposo realiza transportes en un triciclo.

Doña Mireya es  una ama de casa muy luchadora y trabadora que para ganar algo por su cuenta y contribuir en los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa, allí a pesar de que su negocio es pequeño sus clientes pueden encontrar de todo desde granos hasta legumbres y carnes, es por eso que a pesar de que su negocio recién tiene dos años su clientela a crecido mucho, ahora con la ayuda de los créditos que ha recibido del banco cada día aumenta su negocio. El cual  le sirve de mucho ya que su esposo hay días que no gana nada de dinero en su labor.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar arroz, azúcar y otros productos de primera necesidad. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por  ayuda que le dan los créditos para salir adelante.
 
Su sueño es comprar un carro para que su marido realice sus fletes.
texts.en:
The "Efrén Flor" communal bank meets every fifteen days in the parish of Picoaza of the city of Portoviejo. This place is renowned for being a very commercial area, for its traditional feasts of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for its joyful people.

This is a group of people who, some time ago, decided to unite and create the communal bank. It has served them well, because the loans have enabled them to improve their small businesses. They work in various activities such as commerce, services, and food sales amongst others.

One of the members of this group is Señora Mireya. She is 50 years old, has a partner with whom she has four children. All of them are grown up, but they still live at home. Her husband works transporting goods with his tricycle. 

Mireya is a very hard-working and active housewife, who works in commerce to earn her own money and contribute to household expenses. She has a small convenience store in her home. Although her business is small, her customers can find everything they need there, from grains to vegetables and meat. That is why, in spite of the fact that her business is only two years old, her customer base has grown significantly. Today, with the help of loans she has received from the bank, her business increases every day. This helps a lot since there are days when her husband does not earn anything with his job. 

She will use this loan to buy rice, sugar, and other basic foodstuffs. She has been a member of the communal bank from the start, and she likes it because of the help she gets from loans to succeed.
 
Her dream is to buy a car so that her husband can transport his cargo.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and other basic foodstuffs.

loans.name: Cecilia Dianney

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Cerezos  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Fuerza Y Valor, esta es una zona urbana marginal muy poblada y trabajadora.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Cecilia, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, tres de ellos ya mayores de edad, la menor tiene 15 años y  estudian en colegio y es la única que  aun vive con ella. Su esposo se dedica al comercio.

Doña Cecilia es una muy buena esposa y ama de casa que para ayudarle  a su marido siempre a realizado los créditos para que él lo utilice en su negocio el mismo que es el sostén de toda la familia, su esposo tiene un pequeño puesto en una vía de acceso muy transitada donde  día a día el se dedica a la venta de aguas de coco, sodas, jugos y agua natural. Para aprovechar la época de Navidad ella quiere vender ciertos artículos para vender y así obtener un ingreso extra por el bien de su familia.

Con este crédito va a comprar adornos con motivos navideños y ropa para la venta. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque le brinda la oportunidad de empezar con sus propios negocios.

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y darle lo mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of Los Cerezos, in the city of Portoviejo, the communal bank "Fuerza y Valor" meets every fifteen days.  It is located in a deprived, urban zone that is crowded and hard-working.

Cecilia lives in this area.  She is forty-five years old, is married, and has four children.  Three of her children are of age; the youngest is fifteen years old, studies in high school, and is the only one that still lives with her.  Her husband makes a living in trade.

Cecilia is a very good wife and homemaker.  To help her husband, she has always applied for loans so that he can use them in his business; he is the one who supports the entire family.  Her husband has a small stall on an access road that is well-visited.  Day by day, he makes a living selling coco water, sodas, juices, and natural water.  

To take advantage of the Christmas season, Cecilia wants to sell certain items in order to make an extra income for the well-being of her family.  With this loan, she is going to buy Christmas decorations and clothing to sell.  She has been a member of the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because it offers her the opportunity to start her own businesses.

Her dreams are to continue moving forward and to give the best to her daughter.

loans.use: to buy Christmas decorations and clothing.

loans.name: Juana Trinidad

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Cerezos  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Fuerza Y Valor esta es una zona urbana marginal muy poblada y trabajadora. 

En este lugar vive la señora Juana, tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene 10 hijos, 9 mayores de edad y el último tiene 17 años que estudia en colegio, dos de sus hijos aun viven en su casa. El marido es comerciante.

Doña Juana es una mujer muy luchadora y que para solventar los gastos del hogar empezó un pequeño negocio en su casa, allí vende gas de uso domestico, colas, bidones de agua, caramelos, entre otras cosas. Trabaja todos los días desde la mañana hasta la noche, lleva más de 10 años con este negocio y le va bastante bien.

Este  crédito  lo va utilizar en comprar gas, colas, aguas, entre otras cosas que vende en su local. Lleva un año  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y le ayudan mucho. 
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
Fuerza y Valor Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Los Cerezos neighborhood in the city of Portoviejo.  This is a very populated and hardworking marginal urban area.

Juana, 58, lives here.  She's married and has ten children from this relationship, nine adults and a 17-year-old in school.  Two of her children still live at home.  Her husband's a merchant.

Juana's a woman who strives a lot.  She started a small business in her house to pay for the household expenses.  She sells gas for household use, soda, large cans of water, candy, and other things.  She works every day from morning to night.  She has more than 10 years of experience in this business and it's going very well for her.

She's going to use this loan to buy gas, soda, water, and other things she sells in her store.

She has been in the communal bank for a year and she likes it because the loans are fast and they help her a lot.  Her dream is to get ahead by improving her business.

loans.use: to buy gas, soda, water, etc.

loans.name: Bertha Cleotilde

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal La Sultana se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por las extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

En este lugar vive la señora Bertha, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 20, 10 y 5 años de edad, los tres estudian en universidad y escuela los menores. Su esposo es chofer profesional.
 
Doña Bertha aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la localidad hace varios años, hoy tiene un pequeño bazar y taller de costura en su casa, allí ella se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa y vender sus productos de bazar, además también los fines de semana prepara comida para fiestas o recepciones que se organizan en la ciudad, como ella cocina delicioso todos los fines de semana tiene contratos para fiestas. Cuando no tiene muchas costuras que realizar se desplaza a otras ciudades en el carro del esposo a vender sus productos de bazar, ella lleva más de 12 años dedicada a sus actividades comerciales.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, materiales para la costura, víveres para preparar la comida para las recepciones  y artículos de bazar para la venta. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio.
 
Su sueño es comprarse un carro para ella.
texts.en:
The "La Sultana" Communal Bank meets every fifteen days in Jipijapa canton, which is known as "the Sultan of coffee" and is renowned for its extensive cultivation of coffee, which has an unrivaled flavor, its gastronomy, and the warmth of its people. 

Señora Bertha lives here. She is 40 years old, married, and has three children aged 20, 10 and 5. The three study at university and school. Her husband is a chauffeur.
 
Bertha studied dressmaking at a local academy some years ago. Today, she has a small store and sewing workshop in her home.  There, she works making all kinds of clothing and selling the products in her store. In addition, at weekends she prepares food for parties or receptions held in the city. As her food is delicious, she has contracts for parties every weekend. 

When she doesn't have much dressmaking to do, she travels to other cities in her husband's car to sell her the products from her store. She has been working in these commercial activities for over 12 years.

She will use this new loan to buy fabric and materials for sewing, supplies to prepare food for the receptions, and household products to sell. 

Since the beginning, she has been a member of the Communal Bank. She likes it because she set up her business with a loan from this bank. 

Her dream is to buy her own car.

loans.use: to buy fabric and materials for sewing, supplies and household products.

loans.name: Angela Justina

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal La Sultana se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

La señora  Ángela es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos para salir adelante en su negocio y mejorar su situación económica. Tiene 74  años de edad,  hace varios años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda con 4 hijos los mismos que ya  son mayores de edad, tres de ellos aun viven con ella.

Doña Ángela para salir adelante junto a su familia después de la muerte de su esposo, siguió con el negocio que él tenía en vida que es una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayudan en su trabajo cuando ellos pueden y están desocupados ya que todos sus hijos trabajan. Tiene más de 20 años con su negocio y que por esto pudo salir adelante sola con sus hijos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. 

Su sueño es tener buena salud para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The "La Sultana" communal bank meets every two weeks in the Jipijapa area, which is known by the name of the sultana coffee.  The area is known for its extensive coffee plantations that produce a unique coffee, its food and its warm people.

Ángela is the founding member of the communal bank and she likes it for the help provided through loans that allow people to prosper in their businesses and to improve their financial situation.  She is 74 years old and her husband died some years ago, leaving her a widow with four children.  The children are now all adults but three still live with her.

In order to prosper along with her family following the death of her husband,  Ángela continued with the business that her husband had, a grocery store run out of their house.  The store sells all sorts of products, such as rice, sugar, oil, detergent and fruit and vegetables.  She works every day from 6am until 8pm, or sometimes later.  Her children help when they can, or when they are free - they also work.  She has had the business for more than 20 years and it is with this business that she has been able to prosper with her children.

This loan will be used to stock up the store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent and cold meat, as well as other essential products.

Her dream is to have good health so that she can continue to do well.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cold meats and other essential goods.

loans.name: Marilis Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Esperanza y Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Marilis, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos, uno mayor de edad y dos de 16 y 13 años que estudian en Universidad el mayor y los menores en colegio. Su esposo es maestro de escuela.

Doña Marilis trabaja de maestra  en una escuela de la localidad, pero además de esto también se dedica al comercio, en sus ratos y días libres vende ropa de todo tipo y la mayoría de la mercadería las entrega a base  de pedido que sus clientes le realizan con anticipación, ella entrega a crédito a sus clientes y cobra cada quince días, la mercadería que vende se la envían  desde panamá, lleva con este negocio por más de 18 años y que le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas, vestidos y ropa de niños y aprovechar esta época del año que es muy buena para sus ventas. Lleva más de dos años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan a financiar su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Esperanza y Progreso" meets every fifteen days in the Montecristi canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts that are recognized at the national and international level.  It is the land of the famous Panama straw hats.

Marilis lives here.  She is fifty years old, is married, and through the fruits of this relationship, has three children.  One is older and of age, and the other two are sixteen and thirteen years old.  The eldest studies at the university, and the two younger children are in high school.  Her husband is a primary school teacher.

Marilis works as a teacher at the local primary school, but she also makes a living in trade.  In her free moments and days, she sells all types of clothing, and the majority of the merchandise she delivers is based on customers' orders, and they wait to receive them with anticipation.  Her customers can buy on credit, and she collects payments every fifteen days.  The merchandise that she sells has been sent as far as Panama.  She has worked in this business for more than eighteen years and it is going very well.

She is going to use this loan to buy pants, shirts, blouses, dresses, and children's clothing, and to take advantage of this time of year that is very good for sales.  She has been a part of this communal bank for more than two years and likes it because the loans help her to finance her business.

Her dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, dresses, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Ruth Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Esperanza y Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Ruth, tiene 49 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció y quedo sola con sus tres hijos los mismos que en la actualidad ya son  mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa y  estudian en universidad. 

Doña Ruth tiene una tienda en su casa, negocio que le ha permitido salir adelante sola con sus hijos, en su negocio sus clientes encuentran de todo por lo cual goza de buena clientela, allí vende desde víveres hasta artículos de bazar, papelería, medicinas y  helados de una marca muy reconocida a nivel nacional. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00, además de esto ella también prepara almuerzos para vender, por lo cual todos los días hasta su local llegan bastantes clientes a servirse los deliciosos platos que ella prepara. Lleva más de 5  años  con sus negocios y es así como ella sale adelante junto a su familia.

Este crédito lo quiere invertir en comprar víveres, medicinas, artículos de bazar entre otras cosas que vende. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que les brindan a todas en el grupo con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Esperanza y Progreso" meets every fifteen days in the Montecristi canton, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts that are recognized at the national and international level.  It is the land of the famous Panama straw hat.  

Ruth lives in this area.  She is forty-nine years old.  Her husband passed away a few years ago, and she was left alone with three children.  They are older and of age, although two of them still live in the house with her and study at the university. 

Ruth has a store in her house, a business that has allowed her to continue moving forward alone with her children.  In her business, her customers find everything, which pleases them.  She sells everything from food provisions to bazaar items, paper products, medicines, and ice-creams made by a well-known national brand.  She works every day from six in the morning until ten o'clock at night.  

In addition to this, she also prepares lunches to sell.  Every day, many customers arrive at her house to receive the delicious dishes that she has prepared.  She has been working in these businesses for the past five years and it is through this that she has continued moving forward together with her family.

She wants to invest this loan in the purchase of food provisions, medicines, and bazaar items, among other things she can sell.  She has been a member of the communal bank since it began and likes it for the help with loans that they have offered to everyone in the group.

Her dream is that her children become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy food provisions, medicines, bazaar items, etc.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is 28 years old, and is currently doing farming as a source of income. Growing up, he focused on his parent's business. Now he is married and has one child. He probably needs to become more responsible.  He is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and seeds. These inputs are a great help in developing his business that will possibly bestow him and his family a high income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and seeds

loans.name: Efren

texts.en: Efren usually plows, sows and puts fertilizers on his farmland. To maintain and develop his business, he is asking for financial assistance from ASKI that provides hope to small farmers like him. A loan of PHP 10,000 will be used to buy seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. Efren was not blessed with a good way of living so he practices to become a valuable man and he hopes that his three children will adopt this vision.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Zaitoon

texts.en: Ms Zaitoon is 44 years old and married. She has been doing a stitching business for many years. She has become famous in her community for stitching bed sheets and bags. She initiated her business after her husband’s business failure. She is trying hard to contribute to the family income to support the needs of her family members. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She is a mother of six children, two of whom are school-going. Now her husband and a son are working. She is currently in her third loan cycle and applied for a loan of Rs 30,000 from Kashf. She intends to use this loan to buy raw material including cloth, threads of different colors, zippers, etc. to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy raw material including cloth, threads of different colors, zippers etc.

loans.name: Kibosho Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, who is in her late 20s, is single and has one child who goes to school. She has had a beauty salon business for two years now. She works from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy cosmetics plus a dryer, TV set, coffee table, bed and mattress as well as to pay for household expenses. She has paid back all her loans successfully. 

Fatuma is requesting a loan to buy more salon equipment and repaint her salon. Her dream is to one day be able to open another salon in a different location. Fatuma will share this loan with her loan group, "Kibosho," whose 16 members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more salon equipment and repaint the inside and outside of her beauty salon.

loans.name: Zubida

texts.en: Zubida is 52 years old, married and a mother of two. She has been in the business of shoe making to fulfill the needs of her family members. She is working hard to provide quality education for her children as her husband’s income is not sufficient to bear the daily household expenses. Zubida has gained six years of experience in this field and has improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Currently she in her fourth loan cycle and applied a loan of  30000 PKR to purchase raw materials such as leather, spools of threads, wires etc. She wants to earn more income to support her entire family and also to ensure a better future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as leather, spools of threads, wires etc.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is 35 years old, married and a mother of three daughters and two sons. She has two cows and one buffalo for milking and two goats. In the beginning, she purchased goats and sheep and sold them at the festival of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event). Gradually, she purchased cows and buffaloes to start the business of selling milk. She sells it to many of her neighbors, along with butter, cheese and ghee that she makes from the milk. She has a good client list. Her business is good enough to support her decent life.

Her husband helps in her business. She is in her second loan cycle and has a strong association with Kashf foundation. Now, she has requested a loan of 30000 PKR to buy one buffalo to increase milk production. In this way she would be able to serve more people in her community. She wishes to utilize the profits for her children.

loans.use: to buy one buffalo to increase milk production.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en: Noor is 36 years old, married and has three children. She decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future. Eight years ago she began stitching work in her house. She stitches clothes for half of the people of her community. Through this business, she earns income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of funds she is unable to meet all the orders given by her customers. She is currently in her second loan cycle and requested a loan of 20000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw materials including leather, zippers, spools of thread, etc. With this loan she will be able to complete her orders on time which ultimately will help her earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy raw materials including leather, zippers, spools of thread, etc.

loans.name: Jaguar Group

texts.en:
Juliet, who is in her late 30s, is married with two children who are still going to school.  She has been running a beauty salon for six years now.  She works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to pay school fees, to repair her house by painting and installing door locks, to cover household expenses and to buy salon equipment. She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She now hopes for a loan to open another salon in a different area.  Her dream is to one day be able to build business premises. 

Juliet will share this loan with her loan group "Jaguar," which has 10 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open another salon in a different area.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is a hard-working mother who is engaged in the hog-raising business to generate additional income. She is 45 years old, married, and has three children. Two of them are still studying. Ofelia and her husband want them to earn degrees, so that they will be employed someday. 

Due to the high cost of school fees, Ofelia aims to improve her hog-raising business to increase her income. To improve the business, she is asking for additional capital of PHP 20,000 to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines needed in hog-raising. 

Through this loan, Ofelia believes that she will be improving the business. She is hoping that, someday, she will become financially stable and her children will have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines needed in hog-raising.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame sells watermelon at Domenase. Maame has received a junior high school education. She is single. Maame has been doing this for a year now. She uses her income to pay her utility and accommodation bills. Her loan will be used to buy more watermelon and other kinds of fruit to satisfy her customers. She hopes to reinvest the new profits into the business.

loans.use: to purchase more watermelon and other kinds of fruit to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Kwame

texts.en: Kwame is married and has 4 children. He has received schooling through senior secondary school. Kwame sells farm produce at Domenase, which he has done for 15 years. His wife is a also farmer. Kwame uses his income to pay his children's school fees. Kwame will use the loan to buy farm tools and fertilizers, and to hire laborers to enable him to harvest more of his product. With the new profits from his expanded business, Kwame plans to expand his farm.

loans.use: to buy farm tools and fertilizers, and to hire laborers to enable him to harvest more

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida lives within the local community of Ambatali. She is 42 years old, married, and has two children. Both her children go to school.

Nida manages a livestock and farming business. She has run her livestock for three years and her corn farming business for five years. She is thankful because her spouse is a supportive and industrious person. The couple aims to educate their two children and get ahead in life. 

To make all their dreams come true, she is asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP). She will use this loan to buy hog feed and for maintenance of her farming. She knows that this loan would really be of great help most especially in attaining success in life and with her business.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and maintain her corn farming business

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en: Domingo is an industrious husband and father who operates a farming business. He dedicates himself to this business because he wants to lift his family out of poverty. At his age of 50, he knows the difficulties and risks in farming. But he keeps on working because this is the only source of income he has. Through his experience, he knows the things to do in order to develop his business. Now, he is requesting a loan of 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to purchase fertilizers and insecticides, and to pay labor costs. These inputs will probably be a great help in developing his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and insecticides, and to pay labor costs

loans.name: Kwesi

texts.en: Kwesi  is married and has three children. Kwesi is a motorcycle repairer at Domenase, and has done this work since he was 10. His wife is a trader. Kwesi uses her income to help take care of the children. Kwesi will use the loan to buy tools to make his work easier and faster. With the new profits, Kwesi plans to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy tools to make his work easier and faster.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Sewing has been the business Pacita has been involved in. She has had this kind of business for 20 years. Aside from sewing different kinds of dresses, she also runs her livestock business. At her age, 58, she still enjoys making different kinds of dresses.

Pacita would like to seek additional capital in the amount of PHP 8,000, which will be used to purchase garments, thread, and one piglet. She hopes that she could get this loan in order to satisfy her customers' demands and to maintain the good quality of the dresses she sews. In this way, she could earn better profits which will serve to help meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase garments and thread for her sewing business and one piglet for her livestock business.

loans.name: Kweku

texts.en:
Kweku is a corn mill operator who also produces charcoal for sale in Domenase. He is married and has three children. His wife is a farmer. Kweku is responsible for the general upkeep of his home.

Kweku has been in business for three years. He needs a loan from Kiva to buy another corn mill grinder and enable him to produce more charcoal to increase his sales. Kweku hopes to reinvent his new profits into the business.

loans.use: to buy another corn mill grinder and produce more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ekua Akosua

texts.en:
Ekua Akosua is a hairdresser at the market at Domenase. She has been engaged in this business for the past 10 years. Her husband is a herbal doctor, and they have three children. Ekua Akosua uses her income to help her husband support their children. 

She will use her loan to purchase hair extensions, hair creams, and a dryer to help her work more efficiently. She intends to use her new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions, hair creams, and a dryer to help her work more efficiently

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame  sells sugar cane at Domenase.  She is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. Maame has been selling sugar cane for five years. She helps her husband to take care of the children. Her loan will be used to buy more sugar cane for resale. She hopes to reinvest her profits  into the business.

loans.use: to buy more sugar cane for resale.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is married and has five children.  Aba sells cooked rice and vegetable sauce at Domenase, which she has done for 15 years. Her husband is a mason. Aba uses her income to help her husband with the upkeep of their home. Aba will use the loan to purchase bags of rice and other items to prepare her food for sale. With the new profits Aba will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and other items to prepare her food for sale

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama  sells cosmetics,  ladies' and children's wear, fabrics and underwear at Domenase.  She is a single parent and has one child. Ama has been in this business   for five years. As a single parent, she uses her income to feed and clothe her child.  Her loan will be used to buy ladies' and children's wear, underwear, cosmetics and fabrics  for resale. She hopes to use the new profits  to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ladies' and children's wear, underwear, cosmetics and fabrics  for resale

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi sells provisions at the Domenase market. She has been engaged in this business for the past 12 years. Her husband is a farmer and they have five children. Esi assists her husband in the general upkeep of their home and the support of their family. 

Her loan will be used to buy more provisions like tinned tomatoes, milk, milo, and biscuits for sale. She intends to use the new profits to reinvest into the business.

loans.use: to buy more provisions like tinned tomatoes, milk, milo, and biscuits to offer for sale

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame earns an income from selling provisions at the Domenase market, which she has done for the past 11 years. Her husband is a farmer. They have three children, and Maame uses her income to help her husband to support the family. 

Maame will use her loan funds to purchase more provisions such as rice, sugar, milk, and milo, which she will sell to her customers. With the new profits from her expanded venture, Maame plans to further expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions such as rice, sugar, milk, and milo to offer for sale

loans.name: Atta

texts.en:
Atta sells provisions at Domenase.  She is married and has one child.

Atta has been selling provisions for a year now. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their utility and accommodation bills. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions like tinned tomatoes, milk, Milo (malted milk), and biscuits for sale. 

She will reinvest the new profits into the business.

loans.use: to buy more provisions like tinned tomatoes, milk, Milo, and biscuits for sale.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is a food vendor. She sells banku with vegetable soup at Domenase. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a farmer. 

Aba has been selling banku for 15 years. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. 

Aba's loan will be used to buy bags of maize and other ingredients, to prepare her soup and banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize and other ingredients, to prepare her soup and  banku for sale.

loans.name: Roin

texts.en:
Roin, age 26, is involved in a family agricultural business in a small village in Adigeni district. He lives with his wife and two daughters. He owns a plot of land where he grows potatoes and haricot. In addition, he has a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese production. Roin sells the harvested produce and cheese locally in an open market at a good price. Roin is very hard-working and has gained valuable experience in his business. 

He has requested a loan in order to purchase cheese and nuts from local farmers. After buying this stock of nuts and cheese, he will resell them at a higher price. This will increase the income of the family. With the increased income, they will be able to improve their living conditions. 

Roin is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cheese and nuts to offer for sale

loans.name: Nodar

texts.en:
Nodar is 52 years old, from the small village of Adigeni district. He lives with his wife and 22-year-old son. 

Nodar is involved in the agricultural business. In particular, he has a plot of land, where potatoes and haricot are grown. He also has a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese production. Nodar locally sells the harvested products and cheese in an open market, at a good price. Nodar is very hard-working and has rich experience in his business. 

Nodar requested a loan to purchase cheese and nuts from local farmers. After buying the stock of cheese and nuts, he will resell them at higher prices. This will increase the income of the family. 

With increased income, Nodar will be able to improve the living conditions of the family. Nodar awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase cheese and nuts for resale.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is 50 years old and from a small village in Ninotsminda district. She lives with her two children, daughter-in-law, and infant grandchild. 

Rima is involved in the agricultural business. In particular, she has a milk cow. Rima milks cows and produces dairy products which are sold locally in an open market at a good price. She is very hardworking woman and has a rich experience in her business. 

Rima requested a loan for purchasing a milk cow. After purchasing an additional milk cow, she will be able to produce more dairy products. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income, they will improve their living conditions. Rima awaits your support

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Tehreen

texts.en:
Tehreen, age 23, operates a stitching business to earn an income. She has been engaged in this business for the past two years. Her husband works as a laborer, but his income is not enough to meet the household expenses, which is why Tehreen began stitching. In this way, she is better able to meet the needs of her family. She has gained many regular customers over the past two years. 

At present, her sewing machine needs considerable repair work. She has decided to purchase a new one, but due to her limited income, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 10,000/-. This investment will help her to stitch clothes better and in less time. 

She wishes to spend her expected profits on the betterment of her family members' standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is 41 years old. She lives in a small village of Sagarejo district with her husband and 22-year-old son. Maia works as a teacher at a local school and gets a monthly income. 

The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they keep pigs in their yard and sell piglets locally at a good price. 

Maia is very hardworking woman. She requested a loan for purchasing feed for the pigs. After purchasing the feed, their pigs will be fattening properly. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income, they will be able to improve their living conditions for the family. Maia awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the pigs

loans.name: Bavi

texts.en:
Bavi is a 48-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children. She has operated a crockery business for two and a half years. The man shown in the photo above is Bavi’s husband. He has a private job, but his income is not sufficient to meet their household expenses so Bavi started her crockery business with her husband's support.

She has gradually improved her business with the help of the Kashf foundation. She applied for a loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase a variety of products such as dinner sets, tea sets, and glasses of different sizes to sell. She expects to increase her net income and wishes to utilize the profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase dinner sets, tea sets, and glasses to sell

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 33-year-old, married woman. For the past 20 years, Shahida has been running a business of milk sales. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread-earner at that point in time. 

With the passage of time, Shahida's sales and income increased. Now she has two cows and one bull. This has all happened due to her courage and determination.

Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as in financial matters. She is a mother of three daughters and two sons. All children are going to school. Shahida wishes to provide quality education to them for their bright future. 

Shahida has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 35,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf Foundation for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo for her business of milk sales.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 32-year-old, married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last six years, with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Yasmeen’s husband. 

Yasmeen offers various goods in her store for daily use. She has good communication skills and she counts on a good client list. Her husband is also a shopkeeper and has good marketing skills to retain customers. By now, they have become popular in their community because they provide good quality items at reasonable prices, as compared to other shopkeepers. Both are motivated to provide for their family. 

For the growth of her business, Yasmeen contacted Kashf Foundation for the first time and requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy from the market stocks of rice and flour at lower rates. She then would be able to consistently meet the increasing customer demand. Yasmeen wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice and flour for her general store.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia, age 23, has been earning an income from making clay pots for the past three years. She is highly skilled at her work and has been running her business with the support of her husband. They both play an important role in the expansion of the business. Nazia has various techniques and tools for creating the different designs of her assorted clay pots. 
 
She has now decided to buy a used electric machine and additional packs of clay powder so as to increase her productivity and improve the quality of her hand-made items, which are very popular in her community. For this purpose, she has applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. 

She is confident that this investment will increase her earnings, and she intends to use the expected profits on improving her family's standard of living. 
 
She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to buy a used electric machine and additional packs of clay powder

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Ms. Nazia is a 28-year-old young married woman. She is the mother of two children. 

She has been in the business of making clay pots for the past five years. She makes beautiful pots in various sizes, types and designs. Her husband also assists her in making and selling the pots to the market. She mostly uses the hand running tool to prepare the clay pots, which takes much time. She makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

In order to purchase used electricity machines to increase her productivity and the quality of the clay pots, Nazia contacted Kashf foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 15,000. 

In this way, Nazia would be able to increase the sales of pots to the nearest cities. She wishes to spend part of the income on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase used electricity machines to increase her productivity and the quality of the clay pots.

loans.name: Rasoolan

texts.en:
Rasoolan is a 39-year-old, married woman. She has been doing a business of milk sales for many years. She has seven cows in milk, one bull, and nine baby cows and buffaloes. 

In the beginning, she bought one cow and started selling milk. Then she took an idea from her neighbors and started breeding cattle, to sell them at the festival of Eid-ul-Azha, etc. With the profit and Kashf Foundation loan, she purchased more cows to increase the business of selling milk. 

She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter, cheese, and dasi ghee that she makes from the milk. She has a good client list. Her business is good enough to help her lead a decent life.

Rasoolan has five children. Her sons also help in her business. 

Rasoolan is in her sixth loan cycle and she has a strong association with Kashf Foundation. She has taken several loans and each time she has shown excellent behavior. 

Now, Rasoolan requests a loan of PKR 50000 to buy one more cow, to increase the production capacity of milk. In this way, she would be able to serve more people in her community. Rasoolan desires to provide quality education to her children for their bright future.

loans.use: to buy one cow, to increase the production capacity of milk.

loans.name: Nargas

texts.en:
Nargas is a 36-year-old, married woman. The man shown in the photo is Nargas’ husband. He has a small shoe-making factory near their home. He has employed three workers in his factory. 

Nargas helps her husband to polish shoes when they are ready from the factory. In this way, she saves labor cost and also saves money for her family. She is a mother of six children. Two of them go to school. 

For the improvement of her husband’s business, Nargas requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase raw materials such as leather sheets, soles, and plastic leather. With these materials, her husband would be able to complete orders on time. 

Nargas wishes to spend part of the profits on providing quality education to their children and part of the profits on the renovation of their house.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as leather sheets, soles, and plastic leather, to support her husband's shoe-making factory.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Ms. Abida is a 40-year-old married woman. She is a passionate woman and has been doing the work of sewing clothes for the last ten years with her husband. The man shown in the photo is Abida’s husband. 

Both are working night and day making elegant dresses for women in their community. Their designs collection is very famous in their town. Ms. Abida also buys cloth from the market and makes dresses to sell. They offer a variety of clothes in different colors to customers and make enough money to lead a decent life.

Abida and her husband are loving parents of two daughters and two sons. They are in charge of providing them with good food, health and education. They have steadily improved the business by taking loans from the Kashf Foundation. 

Now, Abida requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 to buy a stock of more cloth in different colors and various designs with packs of laces and thread. She hopes to have more profits and hence, better support her family. 

The couple also shared that they aspire to save money for their daughters’ marriages.

loans.use: to buy a stock of more cloth in different colors and various designs with packs of laces and thread.

loans.name: Samra

texts.en:
Samra is 26 years old and married. She has one child. She is striving to meet their demands, including food, clothing, and health-related expenses. Her husband is also doing a job of cloth sales but his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family members. Therefore, Samra started her business to contribute in the family income.

She has been in the business of sewing for several years. She is well familiar with stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf foundation; she has taken a loan to expand her business and increase her household income at present. She enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. 

Samra requested a loan of PRK 25,000 to buy a stock of thread of different colors, buttons, and cloth of different designs, etc. Then she would be able to meet the demand of her customers without fail. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her child through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread of different colors, buttons, and cloth of different designs, etc.

loans.name: Sanobar

texts.en: Ms. Sanobar is 41 years old and a married woman. She is doing work stitching at home while her husband is running a car auto mobile workshop, but he doesn’t earn enough income to fulfill the basic needs of life. For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation upon the suggestion of her street fellows. Currently she has applied for a loan of Rs. 25,000 to buy more spools of thread with packs of buttons, lace, and zippers in various colors. She provides good education and food for her children. She hopes to earn an increase in her net income and wishes to spend part of the revenue on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread with packs of buttons, lace, and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: Iganes

texts.en:
Iganes is 41 years old. He lives in a small village of the Akhaltsikhe district with his wife and three children. 

The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a plot of land where potatoes, maize and haricot are grown. They sell the harvested products locally in an open market at a good price. 

Iganes is very hardworking man and has a rich experience in his business. He requested a loan for purchasing a car. After purchasing the car, he will be able to transport the harvested products and sell them in the nearby villages of Akhaltsikhe district. 

This will increase the sales and thus the income of the family will be increased. With increased income, Iganes will improve the living conditions for his family. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a car for transporting the harvested products to market.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La economía es uno de los factores esenciales para el desarrollo de una familia, por esta razón, muchas personas deciden buscar mejores oportunidades laborales para brindar mejores condiciones de vida. Este es el caso de Nancy, una mujer de 36 años de edad,  conciente de que trabajando es la única forma de ofrecerle a su familia un mejor futuro, este deseo la lleva cada mañana a levantarse muy temprano y ha comenzar su faena; se dedica a la fabricación y comercialización de arepas, actividad que le ha permitido sostener a su familia. 

Es una mujer perseverante y llena de sueños. Su principal proyecto es poder realizarle mejoras locativas a su negocio con el fin de incrementar la productividad y la calidad. Por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito ya que no cuenta con recursos propios para materializar su sueño.
texts.en:
Income is one of the essential factors in order for a family to grow.  It is for this reason that many people decide to seek better work opportunities in order to improve their living conditions.

This is the case with Nancy, age 36.  She knows that working is the only way to offer her family a better future.  She carries this desire with her every morning when she gets up very early and starts her work.  She makes and sells ‘arepas’ [corn cakes].  This business activity has allowed her to support her family.

She is a persevering woman full of dreams.  Her main project is to be able to make improvements to her business in order to increase the productivity and quality.  That is the reason she is requesting a loan because she does not have her own resources to make her dream come true.

loans.use: to make improvements to her business of making 'arepas' [corn cakes]

loans.name: Yolima Astrid

texts.es: Yolima tiene 21 años de edad y le apasiona estudiar, desafortunadamente su familia no cuenta con los recursos para pagarle los estudios universitarios. Aunque es consiente de la situación, ha agotado todas las instancias para lograr su propósito. Decidió vender productos Amway para la salud, belleza y el hogar, actividad que no le quita mucho tiempo y le genera recursos que destinará para su estudio. Por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar surtido para la temporada de fin de año, ya que no cuenta con recursos propios para realizar dicha inversión. Yolima es una mujer llena de sueños y proyectos y tiene claro que lo más importante es su educación porque de esto depende su futuro y el de su familia. Desea poder graduarse y ejercer su carrera para ayudar a su familia y mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en:
Yolima is twenty-one years old and is passionate about studying.  Unfortunately, her family does not have the resources to pay for her university studies.  Although she consents to the situation, she has tried and exhausted all means to achieve her goal.  

She decided to sell Amway health, beauty, and home products, an activity that does not take up too much time and that generates income that she will use for her studies.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan that will allow her to buy an assortment of products for the New Year season; she does not have her own resources to make the stated investment.

Yolima is a woman full of dreams and projects.  She is clear that the most important thing is her education, since her future and that of her family depends on it.  She hopes she will be able to graduate and use her career to help her family and improve her economic situation.

loans.use: to buy health, beauty, and home Amway products.

loans.name: David Alonso

texts.es: David Alonso de 27 años de edad es un joven emprendedor que desea poderle ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. En la actualidad labora como mototaxista en el municipio de Támesis pero sus ingresos son insuficientes para sostener a su esposa, hijo y hermanas, desea emprender su propio negocio aprovechando un lote de su familia para la cría de cerdos y pollos. Por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de cerdos, pollos, construcción de corrales, cuido y concentrado. David espera que con esta nueva actividad sus ingresos mejoren y pueda cumplirle el sueño a su esposa de tener una peluquería, la cual también ayudaría con los gastos del hogar y mejoraría la condición económica de la familia.
texts.en:
David Alonso, age 27, is a young entrepreneur.  He wishes to be able to give his family a better quality of life.

He currently works as a “mototaxi” [three wheeled motorized vehicle] driver in the Támesis municipality.  However, his income is not enough to support his wife, child, and sisters.  He wishes to set up his own business by taking advantage of a family plot of land to raise pigs and chickens.

That is why he is requesting a loan to buy pigs and chickens, to build corrals, concentrated feed, and provide for the animals’ care.  David hopes that his income will improve with this new business activity.  He also hopes that his wife will fulfill her dream of having a beauty parlor.  This would also help with the household expenses and improve the family’s financial condition.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens, to build corrals, concentrated feed, and provide for the animals’ care.

loans.name: Edwin Andrés

texts.es: Edwin Andrés de 23 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de productos Amway desde hace tres años, actividad que le ha permitido ingresar a  la universidad. Tomó la iniciativa de dedicarse a este negocio motivado por una tía. En la actualidad se siente muy satisfecho con este oficio debido a que lo realiza en su tiempo libre y le genera ingresos para estudiar. Su mayor sueño es poder terminar su carrera y para ello necesita seguir trabajando ya que su familia no cuenta con los recursos para subsidiar su educación. Se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de los productos ya que espera tener una mayor rentabilidad para la época de fin de año.
texts.en: Edwin Andrés is 23 years old. He has sold Amway products for three years. This activity has allowed him to go to college. He took the intitiative of working in this business because of an aunt. Right now he is satisfied with this work because he does it in his free time and it generates enough income to go to school. His biggest dream is to finish his major and for that he needs to keep on working, since his family doesn't have the resources to pay for his education. He is asking fot a loan to buy the products since he expects to have more profit at the end of the year.

loans.use: to buy Amway health, beauty and home products.

loans.name: Jesús  Disney

texts.es: Jesús de 35 años, viven en la zona rural del municipio de Támesis, Colombia. Es un campesino que ha dedicado toda su vida a trabajar la tierra como única fuente de sustento, esta actividad la aprendió de su padre. Dedicado y esforzado a su trabajo, todos los días se levanta a las 5:30 de la mañana para comenzar su faena, cuida de sus animales y posteriormente se dedica a la agricultura. En la actualidad tiene un lote arrendado en donde tiene una terneras, pero desea  incrementar el número de animales por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el que desea comprar 4 terneras para la cría. Su mayor sueño es poder tener un lote propio para generar mayores ingresos y ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jesús is thirty-five years old and lives in the rural zone in the town of Támesis, Colombia.  He is a country man that has made a living for his entire life in working the land as his only source of livelihood.  He learned this activity from his father.  He is dedicated and strong in his work, and rises every morning at 5:30AM to begin his labor.  

He takes care of his animals and later works in agriculture.  Presently, he has a piece of rented land where he has some calves.  He wishes to grow his number of animals, which is why he is requesting a loan.  He will use the loan to buy four calves to raise.  

His greatest dream is to be able to have his own piece of land in order to generate a better income and to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy four calves to raise.

loans.name: José Arnulfo

texts.es: José Arnulfo de 57 años de edad es un gran enamorado del campo, toda su vida se ha dedicado a las labores agropecuarias y ganaderas. Laboró por más de 8 años en una granja en donde aprendió sobre la porcicultura, por lo cual decidió retirarse de su empleo y con la liquidación decidió montar su propio negocio. Compró un lote, en donde se dedicó a la cría y engorde de cerdos, actividad que le permite llevar el sustento a casa para su esposa y sus 5 hijos. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito para comprar dos cerdos para la cría y concentrado con el fin de aumentar sus ingresos. SU mayor sueño es poder construir su propia vivienda en el lote que compró para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José Arnulfo, age 57, is a great lover of the fields.  He has devoted himself to farming and livestock work all of his life.  He worked for over eight years on a farm where he learned about pig farming.  That is why he decided to quit his job and use the severance pay to establish his own business.

He bought a plot of land where he devoted himself to raising and fattening pigs.  This business activity allows him to support his wife and five children.

He is currently requesting a loan to buy two pigs to raise and to buy concentrated feed.  He will do this in order to increase his income.  His biggest dream is to be able to build his own house on the lot that he bought.  He wants to do this in order to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy two pigs to raise and to buy concentrated feed.

loans.name: Jesús Antonio

texts.es: Jesús Antonio de 63 años de edad, es un hombre lleno de fortaleza y esperanza. Tras una difícil situación económica se vio en la necesidad de construir un puesto de madera en donde vende dulces. Actividad que le permite subsistir. Su vida se ha visto marcada por acontecimientos que le han dejado grandes secuelas. Su esposa lo abandonó cuando la situación económica empeoró en su hogar, lleno de deudas y solo decidió comenzar y reconstruir su presente para tener un mejor futuro. Debido a esto se encuentra solicitando un crédito el cual espera invertir en la compra de dulces y mecatos de su negocio, con el propósito de mejorar su condición económica y salir adelante. Su mayor anhelo es poder tener una vida digna y pasar su vejez sin necesidades.
texts.en:
Jesús Antonio is 63 years old and is a man full of strength and hope.  Due to a difficult financial situation, he saw the need to build a stand where he sells sweets.  This allows him to earn a living.  His life has been marked with events that have left great aftermaths.  His wife left him when the financial situation in his home worsened.  Full of doubt he decided to sell to rebuild his future and have a better one.

He decided to ask for this loan to buy candy and tools of his trade so that he can improve his financial situation and get ahead.  His greatest desire is to have a dignified life and spend his old age without needs.

loans.use: to buy candy.

loans.name: José Albeiro

texts.es: José Mauricio de 38 años, tiene 4 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, los cuales son su mayor motivación. Aprendió a reparar electrodomésticos desde que laboró en un taller. Después de aprender el oficio se retiró y se radicó en la ciudad de Medellín. Desplazado por la violencia entre pandillas en esta ciudad se fue a vivir a Urrao en donde lleva 8 años, montó su propio negocio de reparación de electrodomésticos como fuente de ingresos. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito para invertir en su negocio en la compra de repuestos electrónicos, pasacintas y parlantes para autos. Su mayor deseo es poder salir adelante y consolidar su negocio. Espera poderle ofrecer a sus hijos una buena educación y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José Mauricio is 38 years old and has four children who are his greatest motivation.  He learned to repair electronics when he worked in a workshop.  Later he retired and settled in Medellin.  Uprooted by the violence between the gangs in the city, we went to live in Urrao where he has been for 8 years and where he set up his own appliance repair business.

He is asking for a loan to buy electronic parts, car stereos, and speakers for his business.  His greatest desire is to get ahead with his son and consolidate his business.  He wants to provide his son with a better quality education.

loans.use: to buy electronic parts, car stereos, and speakers.

loans.name: Cefferino Gustavo

texts.es:
CEFFERINO GUSTAVO tiene 44 años de edad de estado casado tiene dos hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC 26 DE NOVIEMBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Achotillo se cambio de recinto porque le queda más cerca de la Cooperativa, este recinto pertenece al Cantón ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica  a labores pecuarias y agrícolas.

 CEFFERINO GUSTAVO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, abonos, líquidos para las plagas.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá invertir en la agricultura y con ello obtener mejores ingresos. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Ventanas. El sueño es comprarce un carro y un terreno.
En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte y dormir.
texts.en:
CEFFERINO GUSTAVO, 44, is married and has two children. He lives with his wife and children in Ventanas in Los Ríos province. He belongs to the communal bank 26th of November, located in Recinto Achotillo. The bank moved to be closer to the cooperative, and this area is part of Ventanas canton. The members of the group raise livestock and farm.

CEFFERINO GUSTAVO grows corn, rice, and beans. He is applying for a loan to buy seed, urea, manure, and pesticide. He will use the loan to invest in his crops so that he can earn more income. He makes his purchase and sells his products in Ventanas. His dream is to buy a car and a plot of land. In his free time, he likes to play sports and sleep.

loans.use: to buy seed, urea, manure, and pesticide.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to paint his business premises, change the floor, and build a small shop.

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es:
Víctor Hugo tiene 26 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive solo en Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC 26 DE NOVIEMBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Achotillo se cambio de recinto porque le queda más cerca de la Cooperativa, este recinto pertenece al Cantón ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica  a labores pecuarias y agrícolas.

Víctor Hugo se dedica a la agricultura  a la siembra de maíz,arroz,fréjol gandul, además se dedica a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, abono orgánico, ranger, insecticidas. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá adquirir los insumos y semillas para la siembra. El sueño es construir una casa. 
En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar boli y dormir.
texts.en:
Víctor Hugo, 26, is single and has no children.  He lives alone in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  He's a member of 26 de Noviembre Communal Bank, located in the precinct of Achotillo.  This precinct is in Ventanas Canton.  He changed precincts because it's closer to the cooperative.  This bank works in livestock and agricultural work.

Víctor Hugo makes a living in agriculture, growing corn, rice, and pigeon peas, and raising chickens and pigs.  He's requesting the loan to buy seeds, urea, organic fertilizer, Ranger [herbicide], and insecticide.  With the help of the loan he'll be able to get the supplies and seeds for planting.

His dream is to build a house.  In his free time he likes to play volleyball and sleep.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, organic fertilizer, herbicide, and insecticide

loans.name: Álvaro Antonio

texts.es:
Álvaro  es un campesino del municipio de Cañas Gordas, Antioquia, Colombia, dedicado a  la cría de cerdos como medio de sustento. Su familia se encuentra conformada por su esposa y 4 hijos de los cuales 2 son menores de edad. Esta labor la heredó de su padre, la cual  ama porque gracias a esta actividad sus hijos han podido gozar de educación y nunca les ha faltado la comida diaria. 
Álvaro sueña con poder comprar una cerda de cría que le permita generar mayores ingresos debido a que en el mes de enero necesita comprarles a sus hijos los uniformes y los útiles escolares para ingresar a la escuela. No cuenta con el dinero para realizar dicha inversión por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito. Su mayor reto ha sido poderle ofrecer a sus familia una calidad de vida digna debido a que en ocasiones los ingresos económicos no son suficientes para garantizarlo.
texts.en:
Álvaro is a farmworker in the town of Cañas Gordas, Antioquia, Colombia.  He raises pigs as a means of support.  His family is made up of his wife and four children, two of whom are minors.  He inherited this job from his father.  He loves it because thanks to this job his children have been able to have an education and they never have lacked anything to eat.

Álvaro dreams of being able to buy a breeding sow so he can generate greater income.  In the month of January he needs to buy his children their uniforms and school supplies to start school.  He doesn't have the money for this investment, so he's requesting a loan.

His greatest challenge has been giving his family a decent quality of life because at times his income isn't enough to guarantee it.

loans.use: to buy a sow to breed

loans.name: Elisa Maria

texts.es:
Elisa es una joven de 20 años, llena de sueños y con un destino muy bien trazado. Aunque su vida no ha sido como el de una princesa de cuento, ella deja volar su imaginación para alcanzar sus deseos. Es madre soltera de una pequeña de tres años de edad. La cual es su mayor tesoro y su motivación. Desde niña ha laborado debido a la difícil situación de su familia, gracias esto aprendió de confección trabajando por varios años en este sector. Hace un año decidió independizarse y montar en su casa un pequeño taller, en donde cuenta con un socio. Realizan todo tipo de trabajos; pero en la actualidad, se han dedicado a la maquila con un proveedor. 

Se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de una motocicleta, ya que deben salir constantemente en búsqueda de clientes y hacer entrega de los encargos. Esperan que con esta nueva herramienta de trabajo la productividad aumente y los costos de transporte disminuyan, generando mejores utilidades que se transformarán en mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Elisa is a 20 year old young woman full of dreams and a solid destiny.  Even though her life has not been like that of a princess, she lets her imagination run away to reach her dreams.  She is the single mother of a three year old girl, who is her main treasure and motivation.  She has worked hard since she was a girl, due to her difficult family situation.  Thanks to this, she learned how to sew by working in the trade for a number of years.  She went on her own a year ago and set up a small workshop in her home, where she has a partner.  She does all kinds of jobs, but at this time they have one machine and one provider.

She is asking for this loan to buy a motorcycle because they constantly search for customers and make deliveries.  They expect work and productivity to increase with the help of this new tool, and for their transportation costs to decrease, which will translate to better earnings and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to make deliveries.

loans.name: María Oliva

texts.es: María Oliva de 64 años de edad, es una mujer que toda su vida se ha dedicado a laborar para ofrecerles a sus cuatro hijos educación. Comenzó realizando fritos afuera de su casa cuando su esposo falleció asumiendo todas las responsabilidades del hogar. Su vida se encuentra marcada por la necesidad de rebuscarse día a día el sustento para su hogar, debido a que su falta de educación le cerró las puertas para acceder al mundo laboral. Con su inteligencia, valentía y esfuerzo ella ha logrado abrirse paso en la vida. Todos los días comienza su faena muy temprano realizando las tareas de su casa y posteriormente se dirige a abrir su negocio. Su mayor sueño es poder mejorar las instalaciones de su negocio y comprar más surtido para incrementar las ventas, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito debido a que no cuenta con capital propio para realizar dicha inversión.
texts.en:
María Oliva is a 64-year-old woman who has dedicated her working life to providing an education to her four children. She began by selling fried foods from her house after her husband died and she became responsible for her household. Throughout her life, she has had to find a way each day to provide for her family. Since she lacks a formal education, the doors to the labor market were closed to her. 

Her intelligence, courage, and effort have allowed her to make her way in life. She does her housework early each day and then opens her business. Her great dream is to be able to upgrade her equipment and buy more stock to increase sales. As she lacks her own capital to make this investment, she is applying for a loan.

loans.use: to upgrade her business facilities and buy ingredients for cooking.

loans.name: Julio Euloterio

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de fabricacion de estructuras metalicas,el socio realiza trabajos como puertas,ventanas y sillas,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene 6 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de fabricacion de estructuras metalicas.El socio solicita el credito para comprar metales y herramientas.

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
This member makes metal structures such as doors, windows, and chairs.  He works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm and has been doing this for six years.  Things are going well for him and he wants to expand his production.  He is asking for a loan to buy metal and tools.

He is grateful for the opportunity and promises to make his payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy supplies and tools.

loans.name: Victoria Eloisa

texts.es:
VICTORIA ELOISA tiene 49 años de edad es casada tiene 6 hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

 Es integrante de la VRC 26 DE NOVIEMBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Achotillo se cambio de recinto porque le queda más cerca de la Cooperativa, este recinto pertenece al Cantón ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica  a labores pecuarias y agrícolas.

VICTORIA ELOISA se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul, Además se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y gallinas. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, abonos, insecticidas, ranger, una bomba.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes necesarios y la bomba para fumigar la maleza. El sueño es poder tener una buena casa y buenos ingresos para la familia. En el tiempo libre le gusta escuchar notocias, hacer deporte y bailar.
texts.en:
Victoria Eloisa, 49, is married and has six children.  She lives with her husband and children in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  She's a member of 26 de Noviembre Communal Bank in the Achotillo precinct of Ventanas Canton.  It changed precincts because it's closer to the cooperative.  This bank works in livestock and agriculture.

Victoria Eloisa makes a living in agriculture growing corn, rice, and pigeon peas, and raising pigs and chickens.  She's requesting the loan to buy seeds, urea, fertilizer, insecticide, Ranger [herbicide], and a fumigation bomb.  With the help of the loan she'll be able to buy the necessary fertilizers and the fumigation bomb for the weeds.

Her dream is to be able to have a good house and a good income for her family.  In her free time she likes to listen to the news, play sports, and dance.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, fertilizer, insecticide, herbicide, and a fumigation bomb

loans.name: Luisa Del Rosario

texts.es:
Luisa del Rosario tiene 43 años de edad es cadada tiene tres hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en Ventanas.

Es integrante de la VRC 26 DE NOVIEMBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Achotillo se cambio de recinto porque le queda más cerca de la Cooperativa, este recinto pertenece al Cantón ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica  a labores pecuarias y agrícolas.

Luisa del Rosario se dedica a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul, además se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y pollos. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, semillas, insecticidas, líquido para la maleza y una bomba para fumigar.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes y la bomba para fumigar los cultivos. El sueño es poder darles el estudio a los hijos para que sean unos profesionales.

En el tiempo libre le gusta ir a la iglesia a escuchar la palabra de dios.
texts.en:
Luisa del Rosario is 43 years old, married, and has three children. She lives with her husband and children in Ventanas.

She is a member of the 26 DE NOVIEMBRE Communal Bank, which is located on the Achotillo compound. She changed compounds to be closer to the Cooperative. This compound is part of the Ventanas canton, and this “ventanilla” loan is dedicated to work in agriculture and livestock.

Luisa del Rosario makes a living from planting corn, rice, and pigeon peas. She also makes a living by raising pigs and chickens. She asks for the loan to buy urea, seeds, insecticides, week killer and a fumigation pump.

With the help of the loan she will be able to buy the fertilizers and the pump to fumigate the crops. Her dream is to be able to give her children a chance to study so that they may become professionals.

In her free time she likes to go to church and listen to the word of God.

loans.use: to buy urea, seeds, insecticides, weed killer and a fumigation pump.

loans.name: Vicente Rufino

texts.es:
Vicente Rufino tiene 59 años de edad de estado civil casado tiene seis hijos, vive con la conyugue y los hijos en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC 26 DE NOVIEMBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Achotillo se cambio de recinto porque le queda más cerca de la Cooperativa, este recinto pertenece al Cantón ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica  a labores pecuarias y agrícolas.

Vicente Rufino se dedica a labores agrícolas a la siembra de maíz, arroz, además se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y pollos . Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, fertilizantes, insecticidas, urea, líquido mata maleza. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para poder seguir sembrando. El sueño es tener mejores días en las cosechas. En el tiempo libre le gusta escuchar música y bailar.
texts.en:
Vicente Rufino is 59 years old and married. He has six children, lives with his partner and the children in the Ventanas Province of los Ríos.

He is a member of the 26 DE NOVIEMBRE Communal Bank, which is located on the Achotillo compound. He changed compounds to be closer to the Cooperative. This compound is part of the Ventanas canton, and this “ventanilla” loan is dedicated to work in agriculture and livestock.

Vicente Rufino makes a living from agricultural work like the planting of corn and rice. He also makes a living by raising pigs and chickens. He asks for the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, urea, and weed killer

With the help of the loan he will be able to buy what he needs to keep planting. His dream is to see better days with his crops. In his free time he likes to listen to music and dance.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, urea, and weed killer.

loans.name: Maria Eusebia

texts.es:
María Eusebia tiene 48 años de edad es casada tiene tres hijos vive con el conyugue y con los dos hijos menores en ventanas Provincia de los ríos.
