Her loan will provide the funds to meet the demands of her customers. Gulnaz hopes that her loan will increase her revenue and provide a more secure source of income for her family.

loans.use: to buy cloth, colored thread, lace, zippers, and other items

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Ms. Parveen is a 51-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last four years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is also running this general store with her. 

She is a mother of three children. She is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Ms. Shumaila is a 27-year-old lady. She has been doing stitching for many years.  By now, she has become famous in her community and has retained many regular customers. She is eager to support her family and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

So as to complete orders on time, she applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000 to Kashf Foundation to purchase spools of thread with the packs of buttons, lace and needles. In this way she would be able to cater for customers’ orders without fail. She wishes to expand her business in near future to improve the standard of living of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase spools of thread with packs of buttons, lace and needles.

loans.name: Saiqa

texts.en:
Ms. Saiqa is 27 years old and unmarried. She has five siblings; she is the elder among them. Her father is a junior-level government employee with a low salary and his income is insufficient for their family expenditures. To meet her household’s expenditures and provide a bright future for her siblings, Saiqa decided to start a sewing business in her home. She stitches for the people in her communty and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to a lack of availability of funds, Saiqa is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She is currently in her second loan cycle and has borrowed PKR 15,000 from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw materials, including spools of thread, packs of lace, buttons and zippers in various colors. This will help her meet her customers’ demands consistently, which will ultimately help her earn more cash to bring home.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, including spools of thread, packs of lace, buttons and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Mrs. Samina is a 54-year-old married woman. She has run a tailoring business for the past 10 years. She is an expert at stitching stylish dresses for women. She has two children. They are all studying at the higher education level. Her husband's income is not sufficient enough to provide all the necessities for her family. She stitches for the people in her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to a lack of availability of funds, Samina is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. Therefore she contacted the Kashf Foundation and has applied for a loan of PKR 20,000. This loan will help her to purchase more spools of thread, laces and zippers in different colors. She dreams of providing a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, laces and zippers in different colors.

loans.name: Magno Nisson

texts.es:
Magno tiene 32 años de edad de estado civil soltero no tiene hijos vive con los padres en el Recinto PAMPAS GRANDE perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla AHORRANDO PARA EL FUTURO se encuentra ubicada el  recinto PAMPAS GRANDE, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Magno se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. El crédito le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y los cultivos. 

El sueño comprar un terreno para construir una casa. En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte y escuchar musica.
texts.en:
Magno is 32 years old, single, and with no children.  He lives with his parents in the Pampas Grande neighborhood of Ventanas, part of the Los Rios province.

He’s part of the “Ahorrando Para El Futuro” communal bank, located in Pampas Grande and its members farm and raise livestock.

Magno raises corn and rice.  He will use the money from this loan to buy fertilizers, compost, and insecticides for blights and crop disease.  He will make his purchases in Ventanas and this loan will help him improve his income and crops.

His dream is to buy some land where he can build a house.  He likes to play sports and listen to music in his spare time.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Juan Demetrio

texts.es:

El sueño comprar una casa. En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Juan is 49 years old, in a common law marriage and has five children.  He lives with his wife and children in the Pampas Grande neighborhood of Ventanas, part of the Los Rios province.

He’s part of the “Ahorrando Para El Futuro” communal bank, located in Pampas Grande and its members farm and raise livestock.

Juan raises corn and rice.  He will use the money from this loan to buy fertilizers, compost, and insecticides for blights and crop disease.  He will make his purchases in Ventanas and this loan will help him improve his income and crops.

His dream is to buy a house.  He likes to play sports in his spare time.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

El sueño comprar un terreno . En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte .
texts.en:
José, 38, is in a common-law relationship and has two children.  He lives with his wife and the children in the precinct of Pampas Grande in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  He belongs to Ahorrando para el Futuro Communal bank in Pampas Grande in Ventanas, which works in agriculture and livestock.

José makes a living in agriculture growing corn and rice.  With the loan he'll be able to buy supplies: fertilizer, manure, and insecticide to avoid pests and disease.  He makes his purchases in the city of Ventanas.  The loan has helped him increase his income and his crops.

His dream is to buy a plot of land.  In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, and insecticide

loans.name: Raiat Al-Atfal Group

texts.en: This group is called Raiat Al-Atfal and consists of three men who live in Sana`a, Yemen. Qaed is 45 years old, a married man who lives in Sana`a. He is employed in a child-care organization. He has applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB to buy a laptop to use in his work.

loans.use: to buy a laptop to use in his work for a child-care organization.

El sueño comprar un terreno . En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte.

Néstor makes a living in agriculture growing corn and rice.  With the loan he'll be able to buy supplies: fertilizer, manure, and insecticide to avoid pests and disease.  He makes his purchases in the city of Ventanas.  The loan has helped him increase his income and his crops.

Pertenece a la Ventanilla AHORRANDO PARA EL FUTURO se encuentra ubicada el  recinto PAMPAS GRANDE, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

luis se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. El crédito le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y los cultivos. 

El sueño comprar un terreno para construir una casa. En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte y escuchar música.
texts.en:
Luis is 23, single and has no children, he lives with his parents at Recinto Pampas Grande, which belongs to Canton Ventanas, province of Los Rios.

He belongs to the group "Saving for the Future" which is located at recinto Pampas Grande, which belongs to Canton Ventanas and works in agriculture and livestock related activities.

Luis works in agriculture growing corn and rice.  With the loan he will be able to buy inputs like: fertilizer, organic fertilizer, insecticide to avoid plagues and diseases.  He will make the purchases in the city of Ventanas.  The loan helps to increase income and crops.

His dream is to have a lot where to build his house.  During his free time he enjoys doing sports and listening to music.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, organic fertilizer and insecticide.

Juana makes a living in agriculture growing corn and rice. With the loan she'll be able to buy supplies such as fertilizer, manure, and insecticide to avoid pests and disease. She makes her purchases in the city of Ventanas. The loan has helped her increase her income and her crops.

loans.name: Najib

texts.en:
Najib is 42 years old and lives in Taiz, Yemen. He has been operating a vehicle wheels, batteries and oils business for many years. He is able to attract many clients. He is a hardworking man who tries to offer a good life for his family. 

Najib would like to expand his business, so he applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy vehicle wheels, batteries and oils for his business. 

He hopes to open many branches around the city.

loans.use: to buy vehicle wheels, batteries and oils for his business.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Maria tiene 58 años de edad de estado civil soltero no tiene hijos vive con los padres en el Recinto PAMPAS GRANDE perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla AHORRANDO PARA EL FUTURO se encuentra ubicada el  recinto PAMPAS GRANDE, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. El crédito le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y los cultivos. 

El sueño comprar un terreno. En los tiempos libres le gusta  escuchar música.
texts.en:
Maria, age 58, is single and has no children.  She lives with her parents in the Pampas Grande precinct, Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  She belongs to the ‘Ahorrando Para El Futuro’ [Saving For The Future] communal bank, which is located in the Pampas Grande precinct in the Ventanas Canton.  The people there work with livestock and do agricultural work. 

Maria works in agriculture; she grows corn and rice.  With the loan she will be able to buy supplies like chemical and organic fertilizers and insecticides to avoid pest infestations and diseases.  She makes her purchases in the city of Ventanas.  The loan helped her to increase her income and the crops.

Her dream is to buy a piece of land.  In her free time she likes to listen to music.

loans.use: to buy chemical and organic fertilizers and insecticides to avoid pest infestations and diseases.

loans.name: Sili Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel tiene 32 años de edad de estado civil soltera  tiene dos hijos vive con los padres en el Recinto PAMPAS GRANDE perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla AHORRANDO PARA EL FUTURO se encuentra ubicada el  recinto PAMPAS GRANDE, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Maribel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. El crédito le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y los cultivos. 

El sueño comprar un terreno. El gusta salir a caminar.
texts.en:
Maribel, 32, is single and has two children. She lives with her parents in the precinct of Pampas Grande in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province. She belongs to Ahorrando para el Futuro Communal Bank in Pampas Grande in Ventanas, which works in agriculture and livestock.

Maribel makes a living in agriculture growing corn and rice. With the loan she'll be able to buy supplies such as fertilizer, manure, and insecticide to avoid pests and disease. She makes her purchases in the city of Ventanas. The loan has helped her increase her income and her crops.

Her dream is to buy a plot of land.  In her free time she likes to take walks.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, and insecticide

loans.name: Taramaya Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TARAMAYA”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Martha es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de queso, venta de leche, albañiles, venta de verduras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias con distintos rubros, donde la señora Martha es parte integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ganado, cuenta que hace años aprendió este negocio, heredándolo de sus padres.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ganado) que adquirirá de las comunidades aledañas, por mayor,  y posteriormente a la crianza lo comercializará a pedido en la Ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros.
texts.en:
The communal bank “TARAMAYA”  will begin its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of Centro Focal de Achacachi. The group has eight members, and Martha is president of its board. The members work at various jobs including selling milk, cheese, and vegetables and bricklaying. The loan will benefit a variety of micro businesses such as Martha's. She says she joined Pro Mujer two years ago at the invitation of a friend who works for the institution. 

Martha sells livestock, a trade she learned from her parents and has been working at for years. She is applying for a working capital loan to buy livestock at wholesale in nearby communities to raise and later sell and fill orders in the city of El Alto. Her work allows her to earn income to support her household as best she can. She is married and has five children. She says that what she most likes about Pro Mujer is that she now saves money.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Emerita Vicenta

texts.es:
Emerita tiene 33 años de edad de estado civil casada tiene tres hijos vive con los hijos y los padres en el Recinto PAMPAS GRANDE perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla AHORRANDO PARA EL FUTURO se encuentra ubicada el  recinto PAMPAS GRANDE, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Emerita se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. El crédito le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y los cultivos. 

El sueño comprar un terreno . En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte .
texts.en:
Emerita, 33, is single and has three children. She lives with the children and her parents in the precinct of Pampas Grande in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province. She belongs to Ahorrando para el Futuro Communal Bank in Pampas Grande in Ventanas, which works in agriculture and livestock.

Emerita makes a living in agriculture growing corn and rice. With the loan she'll be able to buy supplies such as fertilizer, manure, and insecticide to avoid pests and disease. She makes her purchases in the city of Ventanas. The loan has helped her increase her income and her crops.

Her dream is to buy a plot of land.  In her free time she likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, and insecticide

loans.name: Magali Margarita

texts.es:
Magali tiene 37 años de edad de estado civil casada tiene tres hijos vive con los hijos y el esposo en el Recinto PAMPAS GRANDE perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla AHORRANDO PARA EL FUTURO se encuentra ubicada el  recinto PAMPAS GRANDE, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Magali se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. El crédito le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y los cultivos. 

El sueño comprar un terreno . En los tiempos libres le gusta caminar por el campo.
texts.en:
Magali, 37, is married and has three children. She lives with the children and her husband in the precinct of Pampas Grande in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province. She belongs to Ahorrando para el Futuro Communal Bank in Pampas Grande in Ventanas, which works in agriculture and livestock.

Magali makes a living in agriculture growing corn and rice.  With the loan she'll be able to buy supplies such as fertilizer, manure, and insecticide to avoid pests and disease.  She makes her purchases in the city of Ventanas.  The loan has helped her increase her income and her crops.

Her dream is to buy a plot of land.  In her free time she likes to walk in the country.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, and insecticide

loans.name: Ama Chuma Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMA CHUMA”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Marleny es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: artesana en cartapacios, venta de choclos, venta de verduras, costura de bermudas y chamarras, macramé de mantas, costura de mandiles, venta de salchipapas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Marleny es integrante, ella indica que es hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que le fue a visitar a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de salchipapas (comida), este negocio lo implemento por necesidad, ya que había concluido su trabajo en una empresa decidiendo ser independiente con la implementación de este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papas por mayor) que adquirirá de los carros provinciales y posteriormente a la preparación lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del área de salud y crédito.

En la fotografía no esta la Señora Mery ya que entro a consulta médica.
texts.en:
The group "Ama Chuma" will start their second cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Focus Centre of Alto Lima, it is formed by nine members and directed by a board where Marleny is the President.

The businesses that they work on vary, amongst them are: crafts, shoe sales, vegetable sales, tailoring shorts and jackets, fabric crafts, making of aprons, hot dog and fries sales.

The loan that they will take out will benefit the micro-enterprises that Marleny is part of, she indicated that six months ago she joined Pro Mujer, she joined because a promoter from the institution invited her to her home.  She currently has a food business selling hot dogs and fries, this business was started because of need, her job at a company had ended and she decided to become independent by implementing this business.

The loan will be used for working capital (to buy potatoes at wholesale) she will buy them, make them and sell later on.  This working system allows her to generate income for her family, she is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training they get on health and credit topics.

Mery is not in the photograph as she was in a medical appointment at the time.

loans.use: to buy potatoes at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Las Mañaneras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MAÑANERAS”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Claudina es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de condimentos, venta de ropa, venta de abarrotes, venta de gelatina, venta de verduras, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Claudina es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que le fue a visitar a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de artesanías (tejido), negocio que implemento hace varios años por iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del área de salud y crédito.
texts.en:
Mañaneras Communal Bank will begin its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani regional office.  It's made up of eight members governed by a board of directors of which Claudina is the treasurer.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of businesses, including seasoning sales, clothing sales, grocery sales, gelatin sales, vegetable sales, and food sales.

The loan they'll get will benefit small businesswomen such as Claudina.  She says she has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years, joining on the invitation of an advisor from the institution who visited her at her house.  Currently she has a business selling crafts (textiles), which she set up several years ago on her own initiative. 

The loan she's getting now is to increase her capital to buy wool, which she'll acquire at the street markets in the city of El Alto.  After production, she'll sell in her sales stall.

This form of work allows her to generate income to support her household as much as possible because she's married and has five children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she says the health training and the loans.

loans.use: to buy wool

loans.name: Luz Divina Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUZ DIVINA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María de Lourdes es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de juguetes, venta de salchipapas, snack, venta de ropa, venta de libros, venta de productos Esika, venta de aretes, venta de sandwichs.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María de Lourdes es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de salchipapas (comida), negocio que implemento hace varios años por iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de heladera y garrafas) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del área de salud.
texts.en:
The “Luz Divina” communal bank is beginning its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collapani center.  It’s made up of eight members and directed by a board of directors where Maria de Lourdes serves as the president.  The members have different businesses including: toy sales, salchipapa sales, clothing sales, book sales, Esika product sales, arts and crafts sales, and sandwich sales.

This loan will benefit small businesses where Maria de Lourdes is a member and she says that she has been with Pro Mujer for two years, having joined on a friend’s invitation.  She sells salchipapas (food) and began several years ago on her own initiative.
 
This loan will help her buy a cooler and pitchers at fairs in El Alto and then use them in her stall.  This type of work allows her to generate income to maintain her household.  She is single and has two children.
 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health training.

loans.use: to buy a cooler and pitchers.

loans.name: Bienvenidos Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BIENVENIDA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nelly es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas de vicuña, tejido de busos, venta de carne, venta de verduras, venta de chompas, venta de ropa para bebe.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nelly es integrante, ella indica que es el primer ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una asesora de la institución que le fue a visitar a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras, cuenta que este negocio fue de su madre hace sesenta y cuatro años atrás y ella lo sigue manejando como fuente de economía.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras) que adquirirá de las negociantes al por mayor y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos económicos para su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del área de salud.
texts.en:
The "Bienvenida" communal bank will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, through the Panamericana regional office. It is made up of seven members, and is led by a board, of which Nelly is the secretary.

The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry on are varied, and include: weaving vicuña shawls, knitting sweaters, selling meat, selling vegetables, selling sweaters, and selling baby clothing. 

The loan they will take will benefit small business owners such as Nelly. She says this is her first loan cycle as a member of Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of a field advisor of the institution, who came to visit her at her home. Currently she has a business selling vegetables. She says that this business was her mother's 64 years ago, and she continues to run it as a livelihood. 

The loan she will now take out is for increasing her working capital through buying vegetables, which she will acquire from the wholesale merchants and later sell at her stall. This form of work allows her to generate financial resources for her family, as she is single and has a son. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health education.

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Los Pinos De Corazon Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LOS PINOS DE CORAZON”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Francisca es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, venta de pan, venta de comida, venta de gelatina, venta de awayos, venta de carne.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Francisca es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarla a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida, negocio que implemento hace varios años por iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras y cereales) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la preparación lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es separada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio médico y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The “Los Pinos De Corazon” communal bank is beginning its third cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata center.  It’s made up of eleven members and directed by a board of directors where Francisca serves as the president.  The members have different businesses including: vegetable sales, bread sales, food sales, gelatin sales, awayos sales, and meat sales.

This loan will benefit small businesses where Francisca is a member and she says that she has been with Pro Mujer for a year, having joined after a promoter visited her home.  She sells food and began several years ago on her own initiative.
 
This loan will help her buy vegetables and cereals that she will buy at fairs in El Alto and then sell them in her stall.  This type of work allows her to generate income to maintain her household.  She is separated and has three children.
 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health and financial training.

loans.use: to buy fruits and cereals.

loans.name: Retamas De Mazo Cruz Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RETAMAS DE MAZO CRUZ”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Margarita es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de juguetes y regalos, venta de productos de belleza, venta de calzados, venta de abarrotes, venta de zapatillas, tejido de chompas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Margarita es integrante, ella indica que hace tres ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarla a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de chompas, negocio que implemento hace varios años aprendiendo esta técnica de tejido de su madre.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las tiendas por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido en los comercios de paceños. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The Retamos de Mazo Cruz communal bank will start their third cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Senkata.  It is comprised of six members, and it is led by a board of directors.  Margarita is the president.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses. Among them we have: clothing sales, toys and gifts sales, beauty product sales, shoe sales, grocery sales, footwear sales, and knitting sweaters.

The loan they take will help small businesswomen where Margarita is a member.  She says she has been a member of Pro Mujer for three cycles.  She joined by invitation from a representative of the institution who went to her house to visit her.  She currently has a business knitting sweaters.  She set up her business several years ago, learning the technique of knitting from her mother.

The loan she will now take is to increase capital (buy wool).  She will get the wool at wholesale stores.  After she makes the sweaters she will sell them by order to the businesses in La Paz.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support, as much as possible, her household.  She is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that the likes the training about loans and health.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Granito De Oro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “GRANITO DE ORO”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María Eugenia es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, trenzado de mantas, venta de dulces, sopas y otros, confección de polleras, tejido de awayos, limpieza, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María Eugenia es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, regresando a una banca comunal por invitación de sus amigas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de zapatos usados, negocio que implemento al ver a sus familiares la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de zapatos) que adquirirá de la ciudad Oruro por mayor y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en salud y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The Granito de Oro communal bank will start their second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Senkata.  It is comprised of eight members, and it is led by a board of directors.  María Eugenia is the treasurer.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses. Among them we have: selling blankets, weaving blankets, selling candy, soup and others, making ‘polleras’ (traditional skirts), weaving 'awayos' (traditional cloths), cleaning, and selling food.

The loan they take will help small businesswomen where María Eugenia is a member.  She says she has been a member of Pro Mujer for five years, joining by invitation from her friends.  She currently has a used shoe business.  She set up this business upon seeing her relatives sell used clothes.

The loan she will now take is to increase capital (to buy shoes).  She will get the shoes wholesale in the city of Oruro.  She will later sell them at her sales location.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support, as much as possible, her household.  She is in a common-law marriage and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that the likes the training about health and savings.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Kullaquitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KULLAQUITAS”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María Eugenia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de vicuña, venta de coca, trenzado de mantas, hilado de vicuña, venta de ropa deportiva, venta de herramientas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María Eugenia es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de tejido de mantas de vicuña y de alpaca, negocio que implemento hace varios años aprendiendo esta técnica de tejido de su madre.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de hilo de vicuña) que adquirirá de las ferias tradicionales de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del área de crédito y salud y la revisión médica.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Kullaquitas" will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of its central offices in Collpani.  It is made up of six members and is run by a board of directors of which Señora María Eugenia is the president.  The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied, among them are: vicuna textiles, coca sales, blanket weaving, spinning vicuna thread, selling athletic clothing, and selling tools.

The loan that they have asked for will benefit small businesses where Señora María Eugenia is a member.  She says that she she joined Pro Mujer two years ago at the invitation of a friend who is part of the institution.  Right now she has a business selling blankets woven from vicuna and alpaca thread, a business she implemented several years ago, having learned this sewing technique from her mother.

The loan that she has now asked for is to increase her capital by buying vicuna thread that she will acquire at the traditional fairs in the city of El Alto and will later use to make her products which she will sell by orders.  This form of working allows her to generate resources to support her home as much as possible because she is single and has a son.

When asked if she liked Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training related to loans and health, and the medical reviews.

loans.use: to buy vicuna thread.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy items for her beauty parlor.

loans.name: Prudence 3 Group

texts.en: Evrard, age 37, is married with 2 children, ages 3 and 11 years old. The 11 year old is attending school. Evard is representing the Prudence 3 group. He owns a pharmacy where he sells a variety of medicines. He has been operating for 9 years. He will use the loan to buy more medicine to replenish his stock. His business strategy is to set up his pharmacy near a busy pastry shop in his community. He purposely placed his business where it would be easily accessible to many customers. Evrard has received 1 previous loan from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. He has a good repayment record. He wants to open a large pharmacy in the future.

loans.use: to pay for medicine.

loans.name: Le Sauveur 2 (1) Group

texts.en: Brice, age 43, is single with 3 children, ages 11 months to 13 years old. He has 2 children attending school. He also cares and provides for his niece and little brother. Brice is representing the Le Sauveur 2 (1) group. He sells fish in a local market in Brazzaville. He has been operating this small business for 10 years. He will use the loan to buy more fish to sell. His business strategy is to offer friendly customer service. He greets his clients and treats them with respect. Brice has received 2 previous loans from HOPE Congo. He has a good repayment record. He hopes to expand his business to sell other things in the future.

loans.use: to pay for fish.

loans.name: Le Sauveur 2 (2) Group

texts.en: Roland, age 42, is single with 2 children, ages 10 and 13 years old. Both of his children attend school. He also provides for his nephew and little brother. Roland is representing the Le Sauveur 2 (2) group. He sells smoked fish in a local market. He has been operating this business for 10 years. He will use the loan to buy more fish. His business strategy is to use the loans he receives to increase the amount of fish he can sell, and in effect doubling his profits. He also allows returning customers to buy fish on credit. Roland has received 4 previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. He hopes to save enough money to build his family a house one day.

loans.use: to pay for fish to sell.

loans.name: Prudence 2 Group

texts.en: Aimee, age 42, is married with 6 children, ages 4 to 22 years old. Four of her children are attending school. She is representing the Prudence 2 group. Aimee owns a butcher shop and small food stand. She has had this business for 10 years. She will use the loan to buy beef, tripe, chicken and fish for her butcher shop. Her business strategy is to open early in the morning when many people like to get out and do their shopping. She has received 1 previous loan from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. She has a good repayment record. She hopes to be able to travel abroad in the future. She wants her children to be happy in life.

loans.use: to pay for beef, tripe, chicken, and fish.

loans.name: Sublime 1 Group

texts.en: Mathias, age 52, is married with 6 children, ages 12 to 28 years old. All 6 of his children are attending school. He is representing the Sublime 1 group. Mathias has a butcher shop and has been operating it for 3 years. He plans to use the loan to buy a large freezer to use to store meat. His business strategy is to give a good price to his customers and offer friendly customer service. Mathias has received 5 previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. He wants to become a successful businessman and own several different businesses. He hopes his children will finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Philadelphia 3 Group

texts.en:
Germain, age 42, is married with two children, ages 3 and 10. They both currently attend school. Germaine is representing the Philadelphia 3 group.

Germain has a small soft drink shop, and has been operating for three years.  He will use the loan to buy more drinks to sell. Soft drinks in Congo are still primarily sold in glass bottles; customers bring their empty bottles to a distributor and buy full bottles. Crates of these glass bottles can be very heavy. 

His business strategy is to let people keep their empty bottles in the store, instead of having to carry them all back at one time. He also strives to give each customer friendly service. 

This is Germain's first loan from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. HOPE and his group are confident he can repay the loan. Germain hopes his children continue in their studies, and become successful.

loans.use: to pay for soft drinks to resell.

loans.name: Sublime 2 Group

texts.en: Seraphin, age 45, is married with one 6-year-old child. His child is currently attending school. He also cares for his elderly father. He is representing the Sublime 2 group. Seraphin is an auto mechanic. He has been working as a mechanic for over 10 years. He will use the loan to buy used cars and car parts. He uses the car parts when he is repairing customers' cars. His business strategy is to reduce the price for returning customers. Seraphin has received 5 previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. He wants to build a modern garage shop in the future.

loans.use: to pay for used cars and car parts.

loans.name: Femmes Vertueuses 1 Group

texts.en: Sthela, age 39, is married with 4 children, ages 4 to 19 years. All 4 of her children are attending school. She also provides for her niece. She is representing the Femmes Vertueuses 1. Sthela is an ice cream maker in a local market. She makes the ice cream and sells it daily. She has had this business for 3 years. Sthela also has a side business where she sells clothes, sandals and toys. She is selling toys only for the Christmas season. She will use the loan to buy milk and sugar for her ice cream, and clothes, sandals and toys for her other business. Her business strategy is to be friendly and helpful to customers. She also provides chairs for those who buy ice cream from her. Sthela has received 2 previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. She has a good repayment record. She hopes to make a lot of money one day so that she can help her family and friends with their needs.

loans.use: to pay for milk, sugar, clothes, toys and sandals.

loans.name: Femmes Vertueuses 2 Group

texts.en: Odile, age 62, is a widow with 7 children, ages 22 to 42 years old. The 22-year-old is currently attending college. Odile also provides and cares for a niece and nephew. Odile is representing the Femmes Vertueuses 2 group. She has a stand in a market where she sells oil, clothing and shoes. She has had this business for 2 years. She will use the loan to buy clothing and shoes to sell at her stand. Her business strategy is to have a lot of contact with her customers. She greets them and tries to talk and get to know them. She has received 2 previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. She has a good repayment record. She hopes to travel abroad one day to buy merchandise and bring it back to Brazzaville to sell.

loans.use: to pay for clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Philadelphie 1 Group

texts.en: Jaime, age 41, is married with 3 children, ages 6 to 8 years old. He has 2 children currently attending school. He also provides for his niece. Jaime is representing the Philadelphie 1 group. He owns and operates an ice cream machine. He has been selling ice cream for 3 years. He will use the loan to buy sugar, milk, flavoring and stabilizer for the ice cream machine. It is common in Brazzaville for people to put their soft serve ice cream machines on the street and sell ice cream near bus stops and other busy areas. His business strategy is to make a lot of ice cream during the hot season, as this is his peak season. Jaime has received 2 previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. He wants to have a large ice cream shop one day. He also wants to begin producing his own cones. He will need to buy a machine for this.

loans.use: to pay for sugar, milk, flavoring, and stabilizer.

loans.name: Philadelphia 2 Group

texts.en: Valantine, age 50, is married with 2 children, ages 25 and 30 years old. She is representing the Philadelphia 2 group. Valantine bakes and sells beignets. She has been operating this small business for 22 years. She has acquired a good reputation in her community for her great tasting beignets. She will use the loan to buy flour, sugar, oil and yeast. Her business strategy is to offer good customer service. She always greets her clients and they never have to wait. This is Valantine's first loan from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. HOPE and her group are confident she will repay the loan.  She hopes to continue to work hard and grow her business.

loans.use: to pay for sugar, flour, oil and yeast.

loans.name: Bolingo 2 (1) Group

texts.en:
Peggy, age 36, is engaged with four children, ages 15 months to 15 years.  Three of the children attend school. She is representing the Bolingo 2 (1) group. 

Peggy owns a butcher shop in a local market, and has been operating for one year. She will use the loan to buy more chicken and beef for her shop. Her business strategy is to write competitive meat prices on a board outside of her shop. Whatever is the going rate is in the market that day, she lowers her price by a little. 

Peggy has received two previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner.  She has a good repayment record.  Currently, she rents a building for her butcher shop, but in the future she hopes to build her own structure.

loans.use: to buy chicken and beef for her butcher shop.

loans.name: Bolingo 2 (2) Group

texts.en:
Gabin, age 38, is single with a five-month-old daughter. He is representing the Bolingo 2 (2) group. 

Gabin sells phone credits from several different phone companies. Normally, cell phones in Brazzaville do not have contracts. Instead, people buy phone credits from vendors, and then put the minutes on their phone. Gabin will use the loan to buy more phone credits. His business strategy is to set up his stand in a busy area, and sell as much as he can. 

Gabin has received three previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. He has a good repayment record. He hopes to have more stands around Brazzaville in the future.

loans.use: to pay for phone credits to resell at his stand.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: Ms Shahida is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of three. Her husband has a job in a private company but his income is not sufficient to bear every day’s expenditures. Three years ago, Shahida initiated her own beauty parlor business to contribute to the family income. She has a good client list and has deep knowledge of being a beautician. In order to meet the requirements of her parlor she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000. This loan amount will help her to purchase hair dryers, makeup kits and skin care products. She wishes to expand her business to support her family well.

loans.use: to purchase hair dryers, makeup kits and skin care products.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Ms Bushra is a 33-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four - two daughters and two sons. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. She has been operating a business of lace manufacturing for the past 3 years. She offers various types of laces in different colors, and has become famous in providing good quality lace. She is contentedly doing it for the sake of her family. She is also doing sewing as her part time job. In this way, she is able to handle her family's needs and requirements efficiently.  Her husband also assists her in dealing with the local market to increase her sales. 

It’s her third year with Kashf Foundation. She is satisfied from the support of Kashf foundation and has applied a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy good quality threads, ribbons and pearls in different colors to increase her sales. She wishes to spend the earned revenue on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy good quality threads, ribbons and pearls in different colors to increase her sales.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: Ms Tahira is a 19-year-old lady who is successfully doing a business of milk sales. Her father and brother are also helping her in the business. She has been running this family business for two years. She has two cows and one buffalo in milk. She sells their milk to the people of her community to contribute to the family income. In order to increase the production capacity of milk, she needs to purchase one more buffalo. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of Rs 20,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Ms Tahira is a 43-year-old married woman. She is a mother of three children, and all are school going. Her husband is a low salaried employee. Three years ago, Tahira decided to contribute to her household's earnings and started a business of leather jackets’ sales. In this way she is able to manage her children’s educational expenses. This is a profitable business and she wants to expand it. 

In order to purchase more leather jackets of different colors and designs, she received a loan of PKR 30,000 from Kashf. She has been in association with Kashf for three years. The loan will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more cash. She desires to spend part of the revenue on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more leather jackets of different colors and designs.

loans.name: Ruqayya

texts.en:
Ms Ruqayya is a 40-year-old active, married woman. She has been effectively doing a business of hand embroidery at her home for the last 9 years. Her collection is very famous in her town. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community members. She makes enough to lead a decent life, while her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the everyday expenditures of the household, as he is a mason. 

Ruqayya is a loving mother of four children. She is in charge of providing her family with good food, health and education. She has slowly but surely improved her business by taking loans from the Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase a stock of threads and packs of sequins, glitters, etc. in different colors to complete customers' orders on time. She expects more profits and hence better support for her family. She desires to spend part of the income on providing good and quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of threads and packs of sequins, glitters, etc.

loans.name: Sehrish

texts.en:
Ms Sehrish is a 24-year-old unmarried lady. She has been successfully running a beauty parlor in her community for the past year. She has great beautician skills, and counts on a good client list. She is motivated to provide for her family. 

As she wants to grow her business, she has requested a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy more hair treatment, polishers, and skin care products. She would then be able to consistently meet the increasing demand. 

She wishes to use a part of revenues on personal expenses, as well as to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy more hair treatment, polishers, and skin care products for her beauty parlor.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Ms Nazia is a 30-year-old woman. She is very talented, and excels in the work of hand embroidery; she is very appreciated in her community. 

She started her business at home, with the support of Kashf Foundation. She is living with her family, and has one child. Her husband’s income is not enough to cover the family's expenditures. That is why Nazia wants to support her family by using her talent. 

In order to purchase materials such as sequins, pearls, and spools of threads in different colors, she requested a loan of Rs 15,000 from Kashf Foundation. In this way, she would be able to cater to the demands of her customers time after time.  

She wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as sequins, pearls and spools of threads in different colors for her hand embroidery business.

loans.name: Komal

texts.en:
Ms Komal is a 20-year-old college student. She is a very intelligent and hard-working lady. 

Komal also runs a beauty parlor at her house to support her family financially. During her studies, she also joined beauty parlor training to start her own business. She has gained three years of experience in this field. Komal has become famous in her community for providing the best services to her customers. She makes enough to pay her educational expenses, as well as family needs. 

In order to purchase more beauty products, cleansers and make up kits, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs.20,000. This would enable her to consistently cater to her customers. 

Komal wishes to spend part of profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty products, cleansers and make up kits for her beauty parlor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy reels of thread, soles, leather and artificial leather.

loans.name: Basima

texts.en:
Basima is a 43-year-old married woman. She is the mother of two daughters and two sons. 

Basima works in a blanket retail business at home, to support herself and to help her husband in paying some of the household bills. 

She has applied for this loan to buy more blankets and bed covers.

loans.use: to buy more blankets and bed covers to resell.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Ms. Abida is 40 years old and a married woman. She has been handling a business of crockery sales with her husband. Abida is an active lady and has great potential for growth. Both are doing it together for the sake of their four children. They need to fulfill their demands including food, clothing and education. 

Abida has retained many regular customers and makes enough to lead a decent life. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. She has been in association with Kashf since five years. Currently she has applied for a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase more variety of plates, dinner sets, glasses and bowls in different sizes.  She is hopeful to earn more profit through her large sales. She wishes to spend part of her revenue on providing quality education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of plates, dinner sets, glasses and bowls in different sizes.

loans.name: Nour

texts.en:
Nour, a 28-year-old conservative woman, asked her husband to take her place in the photo. 

Nour and her husband work to support their two daughters and one son. Her husband is a building contractor, while she has a medium-sized food store. Nour works during the day time, and her husband takes her place in the evenings, so she can go home, rest and look after their children. 

Nour has applied for this youth loan to buy some missing food products and a refrigerator for the store.

loans.use: buy a refrigerator for her food store, as well as some additional food products to resell.

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna is a 32-year-old single lady; she is one of nine siblings living in the same house. 

Lubna opened a small office supply store three years ago that is supporting her, and giving her the ability to help the family finances. She also added a copier as an additional service to the shop.

Now Lubna has applied for this loan to add new types of stationary products that work for employees and students.

loans.use: to add new types of stationary products to her small office supply store.

loans.name: Myassar

texts.en: Myassar, a 51-year-old married woman, is the mother of five sons and daughters and is living in a rented home. Myassar has a beauty salon that adds another source of income for the family whenever it is needed. Now Myassar wants to improve her beauty salon by adding new tools and machines for make-up and facial treatments, so she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for make-up and facial treatments.

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna is a 50-year-old married woman. She is a mother for two sons and one daughter. Her husband was working outside of Jordan and retired recently. Muna on the other hand works in jewelry sales at home. Besides working at home; she always participates in bazaars and crafts exhibitions where she can sell the accessories she has. 

Now Muna has applied for this loan to bring in a new collection of accessories that has gemstones in it to increase her profits and be able to open her own jewelry store in the future.

loans.use: to bring in a new collection of accessories

loans.name: Muhab

texts.en:
Muhab is a 43-year-old divorced woman living in a rented house. 

To be able to support herself and pay the rent, Muhab started a business selling plants at home. Every once in a while she goes to the market to get a number of plants and trees, especially those used for decoration. She then sells them back at her house to neighbors, friends and sometimes nearby flower shops. 

Muhab has applied for a loan to build a greenhouse or nursery in the yard at her home to increase the number and variety of decoration plants she has.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse or nursery.

loans.name: Mario Alfredo

texts.es: Mario Alfredo de treinta y seis años de edad vive junto a su pequeña familia; él se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de yuca, además cultiva granos básicos para complementar los gastos del hogar; tiene varios años de trabajar en el rubro y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de mucha incidencia agrícola  muy cercano a la zona donde reside, comercia en todos los lugares aledaños y ya tiene mucha clientela pues todo lo que vende es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además el servicio es excelente; Mario es un hombre emprendedor con muchas ganas de salir adelante siempre está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que se le presentan, en la última cosecha tuvo pérdidas y quiere recuperarse por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de yuca, maíz, frijol, fertilizante, insecticida, etc. Mario Alfredo tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, esta muy agradecido con la ayuda por eso asegura que pagara la deuda y a la vez le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida llena de las comodidades que se merecen.
texts.en:
Mario Alfredo is 36, and he lives with his small family.  He does agricultural work.  Specifically, he grows yucca.  He also grows basic grains to help cover the household expenses.  He has been working in this agriculture for several years, and it has given him a lot of experience that allows him to get the best harvests.  

The land that he cultivates is in an area where there is a lot of agriculture, and it is very close to where he lives.  He sells in all of the surrounding areas.  He has a lot of customers because everything that he sells is of the best quality at accessible prices, and the service is excellent.

Mario is an enterprising man with a great desire to get ahead.  He is always anticipating new opportunities to come his way.  During the last harvest he had some losses.  He wishes to recuperate the losses, and that is why he is requesting a loan from Integral.  The loan will allow him to buy yucca, corn, and bean seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide, etc.

Mario Alfredo has good payment references, and he is very responsible.  He is very grateful for the help, and he affirms that he will repay the loan.  At the same time, he will give his family a better quality of life that is full of the comforts they deserve.

loans.use: to buy yucca, corn, and bean seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide.

loans.name: Hijran

texts.en:
Hijran is a 33 year-old married woman. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) and lives with her family in an IDP Settlement. She is a farmer and is raising seasonal fruits and vegetables. She has six years of experience in this field, which makes her an experienced and skilled person in this field. 

Hijran usually sells her crop in the Central Bazaar. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy.  In fact, many national dishes are made of vegetables such as pilau and dolma. Fresh fruit is served at every table in  the Azerbaijan family and also make fresh punch.  Her monthly income is 50 AZN. Raising crops takes a lot of strength and she works in the open air, this is hard physical labour so her spouse helps. 

She needs additional capital to invest in organic seeds and fertilizers. This will allow her to improve the quality of products she raises and increase monthly turnover.  For this purpose she has applied for a loan of 1500 AZN.

loans.use: to buy organic seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Elnura

texts.en:
Elnura is a 36-year-old married woman with three children. She is an IDP and lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Elnura has bred cattle, cows and sheep for the last 6 years. She is a housewife, and her husband is on a pension. 

Elnura together with her husband usually buy small calves and raise and fatten them for 5-6 months and then resell them for a proft. Her monthly income is 110 AZN, and this business is one source of financial income for her family. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan, and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Elnura sells animals from her house, because transportation to the livestock bazaar or to the markets is too expensive for her. 

She wants to expand her business and improve the living conditions of her family. She applied for a 1500 AZN loan to purchase two cattle, one milk cow and fodder.  This will be her second loan, and she has good credit history.

loans.use: to buy two cattle, one milk cow and fodder

loans.name: Aga

texts.en:
Aga is a 53 year-old man.  He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and two children. As his pension is very low, he has been trying to find additional income sources.  As such, he is a farmer and he has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last ten years. He chose this business because it is profitable and fresh crops are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy.  In fact, many national dishes are made of vegetables such as pilau and dolma. Fresh fruit is served at every meal in Azerbaijan and also makes fresh punch.

Aga sells his crop in the Bilasuvar Central Bazaar. His monthly income is 130 AZN. His wife actively helps him to raise the crop.

As these products are in high demand, Aga wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose he has applied for a loan of 1000 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers. This will be his second loan and he has a positive loan history.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris is 32 years old and is a hardworking mother and a responsible village member. She lives in a village of San Antonio province of Isabela. Her husband is an overseas worker. 

Maricris opened a grocery 10 years ago, and she earns 300 PHP (Philippines pesos) daily from her business. Maricris is requesting a 45,000 PHP loan to purchase snack foods, drinks, cooking oil, spices and other products that she can offer in her community. She hopes that expanding her business will help her husband provide for the family’s daily needs.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, drinks, cooking oil and spices.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
“Nothing is impossible with God,” says Angelita B., a resident of the San Antonio province of Isabela. She is 46 years old and married to Frecisco B., a farmer. They have two children: Jemma and Jenny. 

Angelita and her husband are trying to look for more opportunities to be able to send their youngest daughter to college. Angelita is engaged in a hog-raising business. To further improve it, she is borrowing a loan of 28,000 PHP (Philippines pesos). She plans to use the loan to purchase two piglets and feed. This will be of great help to her family as an additional source of income. She is hoping that through their savings, her daughter can pursue her college education. Life is difficult, but Angelita wants to prove that no matter how hard life is, she will survive together with her family by patiently struggling out from poverty.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is from the village of Cabisera 15. She is 54 years old and is married with three adult children. Beatriz owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month. 

Beatriz is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her sixth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods, drinks and spices for her store.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena has been married to Johnas for three years already and their marriage is gifted with a baby boy named John Ashrow Miles, who is now 2 years old. The couple is full of hopes since they are just beginning with their own family. 

Rowena and her husband started up their little sari-sari store business (a community-based store), which is of great help to their family needs. Rowena aims to expand her business to have a better chance to succeed. For the first time, they requested a loan from the lenders amounting to 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) for the improvement of their enterprise by buying more goods to sell. The couple believes that they must start saving right now for their child’s education while the child is still young.

loans.use: To buy snack foods, spices, noodles and canned good for her store.

loans.name: Mariatou

texts.fr:
MARIATOU est né en 1979 à MANDELA/SIKASSO. Elle  vie chez son époux à Mandela (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elle mène une activité d'achat et de vente de poissons depuis maintenant 2 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et reçoit des commandes de divers clients. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ces clients, elle a décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui elle est en relation depuis 2011 et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra l’achat et la revente de 5 cartons de poissons frais par jour. Il s’agit des poissons venant de la Côte d’Ivoire. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Sikasso. Les ventes sont faites à Mandela chez elle et au marché du village. Sa clientèle est composée d’hommes et de femmes du village et environnant. 
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000 FCFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mariatou was born in 1979 in Mandela / Sikasso.  She lives with her husband in Mandela (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

She has been involved in the activity of buying and selling fish for two years now.  Thanks to her experience in this field, she enjoys a good reputation and receives orders from many customers.  In order to have the necessary resources to meet her customers' needs, she decided to join Soro Yiriwaso in 2011.  All her previous loans have been duly repaid.

This new loan will help her to buy and resell five boxes of fresh fish per day.  The fish she buys and sells come from the Ivory Coast. Mariatou stocks up at the Sikasso market.  She sells in Mandela, from her home and at the village market.  Her customer base is made up of men and women from her village and surrounding areas.

With this loan, she is expecting average monthly profits to reach 20,000 CFA francs.  These profits will help her to pay off her loan's interest.  She will use the rest of the money to invest in her activity.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Margaret Group

texts.en:
The group is made up of five women and one man who have been accessing loans from ID-Ghana (MFI) since 2010. They are: Margaret, a charcoal seller; Faustina, a kenkey seller (cooked corn paste); Leticia, a fish seller; Janet, a gari seller (fried cassava paste with oil to remove moisture); Alexander, a khibab seller (the roasted meat of all kind of animals); and Rebecca, a cosmetics seller. 

ID Ghana has been of great service to them since they have been able to grow their small businesses through the credit scheme. 

Margaret is a 30-year-old charcoal seller married to Justice, who is a 34-year-old driver. She has 8 years experience. She works 6 days a week (from Monday to Saturday). She is constantly working to improve on her business capital. This is her 2nd loan with ID-Ghana and she is requesting an amount of 700 GHC to buy charcoal to sell to her customers in her community. She sells to generate money to take care of family and business.

The group needs a total amount of 2,600 GHC for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to supply to customers

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is from the village of Cabisera 15, San Antonio province, Isabela. She is married to Reynaldo who works as a soft drink delivery boy. They have two children: Regine and Rhena. Gina is a kind-hearted person who is always willing to help other people. She is also a responsible mother and a diligent businesswoman.

Gina sells different kinds of footwear (slippers) for men and women and sometimes she also sells used clothes (ukay-ukay) in their neighborhood. She is hoping to obtain a loan of PHP 10,000 that she can use as additional capital to purchase slippers in bulk and to continue her “ukay-ukay” business. 

Gina plans to send her eldest child to college and to take a management course, thus she really needs to work hard to increase her income and to help her husband to meet their daily needs. Her retail business has expanded and she hopes that it will remain strong until her children finish their studies.

loans.use: To purchase more slippers to sell

loans.name: Shagufta's Group

texts.en:
Shagufta is a hard-working 34-year-old woman. She lives in Pakistan with her husband, two sons and three daughters. All of their children are students. Her husband is a government employee. His income is insufficient to meet their family's needs, so Shagufta is trying to help him by sewing clothes at home. She herself is a tailor, and she wants to generate more income by purchasing tailoring products like fabrics and a variety of threads. 

For this loan, Shagufta as a member of a 5-person group which has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. This will help her to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally and to also increase her net income and savings. She will extend her business if she earns a good amount of profit in the future. Shagufta hopes, with the help of the loan amount, to reach her desired net income and to be able to save for their future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education. 

Note: In the photo, Shagufta is holding a passbook.

loans.use: To purchase tailoring products like fabrics and a variety of threads.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a woman of strong determination. She wants to give her family a better standard of living. She is 31 years old and is married to Joji, a tricycle (three-wheeled vehicle) driver. They are blessed with two children. The eldest is Jeana Jode, the second is Dan Justine. Adelaida is happy with her children and does not have any plans for having another one due to the economic situation. 

With their simple livelihood, Adelaida is aiming for a successful life some day. She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 45,000 to be used for the maintenance and repair of their passenger tricycle. She hopes that her loan will be granted since the school year is fast approaching and they have to save for their children's school allowance.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance and repair of their passenger tricycle

loans.name: Lodivina

texts.en:
Lodivina is from the village of Cabisera 17-21. She is 35 years old,  is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lodivina owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 250 PHP daily from these activities. 

Lodivina is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to buy canned goods, snack foods, drinks and spices for her store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods, drinks and spices.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is 39 years old and is married to Juanito, a farmer. They live in the village of Cabisera 15, San Antonio together with their three children. Guillerma is thankful for having her loving family who choose to be happy despite the hardships of life. Guillerma chose hog raising as her business. 

At present, Guillerma would like to request a loan of PHP 45,000 as business capital so she can buy additional piglets and a supply of feed. She dreams of sending her children to college and of them having a better way of living some day. As a mother, she will do her very best to succeed in her endeavor.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and a supply of feed

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria lives with her husband and three siblings. They are farmers. With the help of her husband and siblings, she grows corn and rice year after year. She herself has four years' experience. 

Gloria is applying for a loan to buy materials that she will use for planting, such as fertilizer, herbicides and seeds. With these materials, she will be ready to improve her business and is expecting to have good results. Her objective is to find the way to have an abundant harvest, so that she and her family can get ahead in life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, herbicides and seeds

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is from the village of Cabisera 17-21. She is 48 years old, is married and has two adult children. Josie is a very kind and understanding person. 

She owns and operates a business venture raising pigs for fattening and sale. Josie has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP when she sells a raised pig.  She is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional piglets to raise and sell in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets for her business.

loans.name: Simplicia

texts.en: Simplicia, aged 60, lives in the village of San Antonio in the province of Isabela. She has been growing crops for the past 15 years. She also grows different varieties of vegetables. Simplicia is taking out this loan to purchase fertilizer and seedlings so she can help her three adult children to have better quality living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for her farming business

loans.name: Zaki

texts.en:
Zaki is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 29 years old, is married and has a child. Zaki is the only provider for the family. He owns a small shop and specializes in photocopying documents and selling stationery. He established his business in 2009 and now he has an employee. He has developed good experience in this field and is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Zaki is requesting a youth loan of $2,000 to buy a new photocopying machine. He is aiming to grow his business and to increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new photocopying machine

loans.name: Jasem

texts.en:
Jasem is from Iraq. He is 52 years old, is married and has four children,  one of whom is employed. Jasem owns a small grocery store which sells soft drinks, juices, detergents, fruits and vegetables. He established his business in 2008. He has developed good experience in this field and is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.
