The communal bank "Amigas de Tilata" will begin its 10th loan cycle with Pro Mujer.  As part of the Focal Center of Cascada, it is made up of 8 group members and is directed by a board of which Mrs. Escarlet is the Secretary.  The businesses that the group members pursue are varied, including the following: selling ice cream, knitting baby clothes, selling sodas and gelatins, selling meals, selling alpaca wool blankets, weaving blankets, and running various stores like tire stores, general stores, butcher shops, etc.  

The loan will be used to benefit micro-businesses with distinct goals.  Mrs. Escarlet is part of the group and she indicates that she joined 6 months ago, by invitation from a friend who is a member of the institution.  Currently she has a business selling clothing.  She notes that she began her business years ago based on recommendations from one of her aunts, who traveled for merchandise to other states.  

The loan that she requests now will be used to increase her capital (purchase clothing), and she will make those purchases in Perú, in bulk, and then sell them in her stall.  This form of work allows her to generate income to support her family as much as possible since she is single and has a child.  

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the help received from staff.

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Ana Dinora

texts.es:
Ana, solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar más mercadería para vender, surtiéndolo de ropa interior, blusas, short, entre otra mercadería que sea del agrado de los clientes, espera que esa inversión le ayude para mejorar su economía.
Con el préstamo anterior comenta que el negocio ha sido más rentable, tiene más surtido el negocio, sus ganancias le sirven para la familia, gracias al crédito Kiva su circunstancias han mejorado.
texts.en: Ana is applying for a new loan to buy more inventory to sell: underwear, blouses, shorts and other items her clients like. She expects this investment will improve her financial situation. She says that, thanks to her previous Kiva loan, she increased profits and earnings, stocked more inventory, and improved her family's finances.

loans.use: to buy underwear, blouses, and shorts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar, salt, and condiments.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: José Francisco de 58 anos de edad, casado con dos hijos los cuales están bajo su responsabilidad y estudian en la universidad y en secundaria. Él  es originario del municipio de Nagarote. Lugar que se caracteriza por ser el municipio mas limpio del país. Por sus comidas típicas como el quesillos, tiste, rosquillas. José Francisco tiene por actividad económica un taller se sastrería desde hace  36 anos que se dedica a dicha actividad. La cual consiste en la elaboración de prendas de vestir de hombre como pantalones, esmoquin, corbatas, togas, camisas. Él siempre ha tenido dicha actividad la cual ha sido su forma de vida y el sustento de su familia. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar materia prima como: telas, forros, botones, zíper, hilos. José Francisco agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a las personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida  digno.
texts.en:
José Francisco is 58 years old and is married with two children, who are in his care. They are studying in secondary school and university. He is from the municipality of Nagarote. Nagarote is characterized by its cleanliness, being the cleanest municipality in the country, and by its typical plates such as fresh cheese, tiste (a beverage made from corn and cocoa), and donuts.

José Francisco has made a living with his tailor shop for 36 years. His business consists of making men's clothing, such as pants, tuxedos, ties, robes, and shirts. He has always had this business, which is his way of life and his means of support for his family. He needs funding to invest in working capital by buying materials such as fabric, lining, buttons, zippers, and thread. 

José Francisco is grateful for the help which Kiva lenders provide to those with limited resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they can have a decent livelihood.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and buy supplies such as fabric, lining, buttons, zippers, and thread.

loans.name: Luz Yaneth

texts.es:
Luz Yaneth de 43 años de edad es una guerrera que ha labrado su vida a costa de luchas y esfuerzos, es madre de tres hijos de los cuales dos son menores de edad. Tras una crisis familiar Luz se vio en la necesidad de comenzar a laborar, por lo cual decidió vender productos por catálogo a familiares y amigos, debido a que por falta de educación le cerraron las puertas en varias empresas en donde presentó su hoja de vida. 
Después de varios años y con lo ahorros que logró acumular,  se aventuró y montó una papelería, la cual labora diariamente de 7 de la mañana a 8 de la noche. 
En la actualidad Luz se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de juguetería, aprovechando el mes de diciembre en donde se intensifica la compra de aguinaldos. Espera poder ofrecerles a sus hijos la oportunidad de ingresar a la universidad porque está segura que éste será el mejor regalo que pueda darles.
texts.en:
Luz Yaneth is 43 years old. She is a warrior who has forged her way in life through struggles and effort. She is a mother of three children, of whom two are still minors. After a family crisis, Luz saw a need to start working. She decided to sell products from a catalog to family and friends, because due to her lack of education, many doors were closed to her in the companies where she presented her resume.

After many years and with the savings that she managed to accumulate, she took a risk and opened a stationery shop. She works daily from 7:00 in the morning until 8:00 at night.

She is applying for a loan to buy toys, taking advantage of the month of December, in which the purchase of Christmas gifts intensifies. She hopes to provide her children with the opportunity to go to university, because she is sure that this is the best gift she can offer them.

loans.use: to buy toys.

loans.name: Álvaro Hernán

texts.es:
Álvaro de 56 años, es casado y tiene 2 hijos de los cuales uno es menor de edad. Laboró por más de 20 años en una caja de compensación familiar. La empresa entró en recesión por la cual se vio en la necesidad de hacer recorte de personal y don Álvaro fue uno de los afectados. Conciente de que la vida continúa y con una familia que sostener se vio en la necesidad de buscar una fuente de ingresos que le permitiera llevar la comida a casa. 

Buscó trabajo por un largo periodo pero no tuvo éxito debido a su edad, por lo cual tomó la determinación de montar su propio negocio al frente de una EPS, con el fin de ubicarse en un sitio estratégico para la venta de fritos. Álvaro cuenta que gracias a este empleo ha podido ofrecerles a sus dos hijos educación y que espera poder trabajando fuerte para ofrecerle a su familia un mejor futuro. Sueña con poder tener un local en donde poder adecuarse y ampliar su portafolio de productos. Por esta razón se en encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de silletería para mejorar sus calidad en el servicio e insumos para incrementar su capacidad de venta.
texts.en:
Álvaro is 56 years old.  He is married and has two children, one of whom is a minor.  He worked for twenty years at a “Caja de Compensación Familiar” (family compensation fund agency).   The company entered a recession and it became necessary to cut staff and Álvaro was one of the affected employees.  Aware that life goes on and with a family to support, he realized it was necessary to find a source of income that would allow him to put food on the table.

He looked for work for a long period of time but wasn’t successful because of his age.  So, with the intention of being located in a strategic place for the sale of “fritos” (fried dishes), he determined to start his own business in front of an EPS.  Álvaro says that thanks to this job, he has been able to provide his two children with an education and that he plans to work hard in order to offer his family a better future.  He dreams of having a location where he can adapt and expand his product portfolio.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan to purchase a set of chairs to improve the quality of customer service and supplies to increase his sales capacity.

loans.use: to buy a set of chairs.

loans.name: Manos Trabajadoras Group

texts.es: La Sra. Elizabeth es casada y tiene más de 5 años con Edaprospo. Tiene 1 hijo el cual aún depende de ella y su esposo. Se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir desde hace más de 10 años. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo ha podido ayudar a sus padres con algunos gastos y también ha podido avanzar con la construcción de su casa. Actualmente su ingreso lo destina a cubrir los gastos de vestimenta y servicios, mientras que su esposo cubre los gastos de alimentación. Su plan para el futuro es tener un negocio mucho  más grande y con más variedades de productos, también terminar de construir su casa. Ella usó el crédito en la compra de mercadería para su negocio. Elizabeth pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Manos Trabajadoras”, el cual está conformado por 7 personas. Ella leva el cargo de presidenta desde hace 2 años.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and has belonged to Edaprospo for more than five years. She and her husband have one dependent child. For more than ten years, she has been selling clothing. With hard work, she has helped her parents with some expenses and been able to continue building her house.

Her income now pays for inventory purchases, while her husband's covers food expenses. She plans to expand business by stocking more variety and to finish building her house. She will use the loan to buy merchandise for her business. Elizabeth belongs to the communal bank “Manos Trabajadoras,” which has seven members. She has been president for the past two years.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Jenny Margarita

texts.es:
Jenny, necesita fortalecer el negocio con mas capital de trabajo, considerando importante comprar ropa en variedad blusas, faldas, tambien comprara sandalias con variedad de estilos para la clientela, esto le ayudara para seguir ofreciendo calidad en la mercadería y diversificar los productos.
Con el préstamo anterior logro tener más variedad de ropa para la venta, así como sandalias, con las ganancias ha cubierto algunas necesidades en su familia, sus hijos están en sus estudios, hoy en día tienen una mejor condición.
texts.en:
Jenny needs to strengthen her business with more working capital. She considers it important to buy a variety of blouses and skirts. She will also buy sandals in a variety of styles for her customers. This will help her continue to offer quality in her merchandise and to diversify her products. 

With the previous loan, she was able to have a greater variety of clothing to sell, in addition to sandals. With the earnings she covered some needs for her family. Her children are in school, and today they have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Oscar Eulises

texts.es:
Oscar, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para poder invertir en el taller de estructuras metálicas, tambien una parte en la granja de gallinas, comprara material para hacer rejas como hierro de diferentes medidas, electrodos, tambien para la granja comprara concentrado que servirá de alimento para las gallinas en la granja.
Con el préstamo anterior manifiesta que logro realizar todo el trabajo, pudo satisfacer las demandas de los clientes, ha crecido en el taller y la granja de las gallinas ponedoras.
texts.en:
Oscar has decided to take out a new loan so that he can invest in his workshop where he makes metal structures, and also use a part for his chicken farm. He will buy material to make metal grates, such as iron of different measures and electrodes. Also, for his farm, he will buy concentrate which will serve as feed for the hens on his farm. 

With the previous loan, he states that he succeeded in carrying out all the work, and he was able to satisfy his customers' demands. He has expanded his workshop and his farm with laying hens.

loans.use: to buy iron and electrodes, as well as concentrated feed for his chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy oil, sugar, soda, and snacks.

loans.name: Mujeres Virtuosas Group

texts.es: La Sra. Florentina es viuda y tiene 9 hijos de los cuales solo uno aún depende de ella, mientras que los demás son independientes. Se dedica a la venta de gas en su propio domicilio. Comenzó con su negocio con la idea de lograr abrir su propia tienda. También se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir. Actualmente su ingreso lo destina a cubrir los gastos familiares y para capital de trabajo. Su plan para el futuro es ampliar su negocio y terminar de construir su casa. Ella usó el crédito en la compra de mercadería para su negocio. Florentina pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Mujeres Virtuosas”, grupo que recién lleva 8 meses desde que se formó y está conformado por 7 personas. Le pusieron dicho nombre al grupo debido a que todas son mujeres y su mayor virtud es la de ser madres.
texts.en:
Florentina is a widow and has nine children. Only one still depends on her, while the rest are independent. She makes a living selling gas from her home. She started this business with the idea of opening her own store. She also sells clothing. 

She currently uses her income to cover her family's expenses and for working capital. Her plan for the future is to expand her business and finish construction on her house. She will use the loan to buy merchandise for her business. 

Florentina belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres Virtuosas" ("Virtuous Women"), a group which formed 8 months ago and which is composed of 7 members. They decided on their name because all of the members are women and their greatest virtue is that of being mothers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Jose Candelario

texts.es:
José, se decidió solicitar el siguiente crédito porque necesita más capital de trabajo para ampliar la mercadería y diversificarla en cuanto a la venta de mariscos.
El dinero lo invertirá en la compra de pescado, camarones y otros para la venta a sus clientes, manifiesta que el crédito anterior le dio efectos muy importantes ya que el fortalecimiento de su  negocio  ha dejado resultados favorables para  el hogar, sus hijos continúan con sus estudios y tienen una mejor alimentación y salud.
texts.en: José decided to apply for this loan because he needs working capital to buy inventory and diversify by selling shellfish. He will use the loan to buy seafood, shrimp, and more to sell to his customers. He says his previous loan was very important because he was able to increase his business and help his family. His children are continuing their education, are eating better, and are healthy.

loans.use: to buy seafood and shrimp.

loans.name: Reina Maritza

texts.es:
Reina, vive con sus hijos de 17 años y otro de 35, se dedica a la venta de tamales y tortillas, este negocio está ubicado en la casa de habitación, para la venta de los tamales se traslada al mercado, tiene una experiencia de 15 años.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para la elaboración de tamales y tortillas, comprando maíz por mayoreo, hojas, pollo, condimentos, verduras, y otros gastos que le puedan surgir, esto le ayudara para que Reina tenga la capacidad para salir con los encargos.
Su objetivo es a través del negocio tener una mejor calidad de vida, poder ayudar a sus hijos y sacarlos adelante con los estudios.
texts.en:
Reina lives with her children, ages 17 and 35. She makes a living selling tamales and tortillas. Her business is located in her home, and she goes to a marketplace to sell the tamales. She has 15 years of experience.

She has applied for a loan to buy materials for making tamales and tortillas. She will buy wholesale corn, corn husks, chicken, condiments, vegetables, and she will also cover other expenses which may arise. This will help her to continue with her responsibilities. Her goal is to have a better quality of life through her business, to help her children and support their education.

loans.use: to buy wholesale corn, corn husks, chicken, condiments, and vegetables.

loans.name: Yobana Margarita

texts.es:
Yobana, es una persona muy trabajadora  tiene tres hijos vive con su madre,  dos de sus hijos están estudiando, tiene apoyo de sus familiares. Se dedica a la venta de quesadillas, tamales, pan dulce y francés. El negocio lo practica desde hace mucho tiempo pero necesita crecer y diversificar los productos para mejorar a la competencia. 
Está solicitando un préstamo ya que necesita insumos para la elaboración de tamales y mas latas de quesadilla, tambien comprara pan dulce y francés. El préstamo le ayudara a mejorar sus productos ya que manifiesta que en los últimos tiempos las ventas  han mejorado.
Su  sueño es mejorar el local, pintarlo y ampliarlo, terminar de darle la educación a sus hijos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yobana is a very hardworking person. She has three children, two of whom are studying. She lives with her mother and has support from her family members.

She makes a living selling quesadillas, tamales, sweet bread and French bread. She has had this business for a long time, but she needs to grow and diversify her products to improve her ability to compete with other businesses.

She is applying for a loan because she needs supplies to make tamales and pans to make quesadillas. She will also buy sweet bread and French bread. The loan will help her to improve her products. Recently, she has showed an improvement in sales.

Her dream is to improve her shop by painting and expanding it, as well as providing her children with an education and improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make tamales and pans to make quesadillas.

loans.name: Mirna Yessenia

texts.es:
Mirna, necesita ampliar su negocio es por ello que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar otro préstamo, para invertirlo en la compra de productos  de enchape y oro tales como pulseras, aretes, anillaos, dijes y cadenas tobilleras.
 Manifiesta que el crédito anterior dio resultados contundentes ya que mejoro en la venta de enchape  y  esto le ha permitido salir con los compromisos del hogar.
La familia se mantiene, su negocio ha mejorado y esto le permitido salir adelante con su hogar y mantenerse en el mercado,  su sueños es diversificar los productos y  construir su propia vivienda  y sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mirna needs to expand her business, and therefore she has made the decision to apply for another loan, to invest in buying gold and plated products such as bracelets, earrings, rings, pendants and ankle bracelets. 

She reports that the previous loan gave her convincing results, since she improved in the sale of plated items, and this allowed her to meet her commitments in the household. 

Her family is being supported, her business has improved, and this has permitted her to get ahead with her household and maintain her position in the market. Her dreams are to diversify her products, build her own house and help her children get ahead.

loans.use: to buy plated bracelets, earrings, rings, pendants, and ankle bracelets.

loans.name: Selevester

texts.en: Selevester is a 26-year-old married man.  He has two children and they all live in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a very hardworking man who practices agriculture in order to earn a living. With the proceeds from farming he started a retail shop to meet the daily family basic needs like food and medicine.  Like most farmers he is faced with challenges of  unpredictable weather conditions, price fluctuations, and high transportation costs of the produce. He dreams of venturing into mechanized agriculture and owning a wholesale shop.  Selevester intends to use the loan to pay his employees on the farm and buy rice,maize flour, and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to pay his employees and buy rice, maize flour, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Sonex

texts.en: Sonex is a twenty-three-year-old hardworking man living in Kasese,Uganda.  He grows sugar cane and the business has been very lucrative due to the available ready market. With the income earned he has been able to pay school fees for his siblings and buy more land. Unpredictable weather changes and diseases affect his projected profits.  His dreams are to be able to supply directly to sugar factories and build a permanent residential house. Sonex intends to use the loan to plant more sugar cane.

loans.use: to plant more sugar cane

loans.name: Shemu

texts.en:
Shemu is a thirty-two-year-old married man who has three children.  They all live in Kasese,Uganda. Ten years ago he decided to venture into the retail business in order to provide basic needs for his growing family since farming was seasonal and did not allow him to meet their daily expenses. He wishes to construct a permanent residential house and expand his business to new areas, despite challenges of stiff competition and high transport costs.  
Shemu is requesting a loan to buy sugar, salt, clothes, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, clothes, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria, se ha decidido por otro crédito por la temporada navideña para elevar el nivel de ventas y mejorar sus ingresos  ella se dedica a la venta de verduras. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra  de manzanas, fresas, uvas, peras, kiwis, papaya, manifiesta que el préstamo anterior  mejoro las ventas  y aumento sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Con el crédito anterior mejoro su economía y aumento el inventario compro una cocina y otros electrodomésticos.
texts.en:
Gloria has decided to apply for another loan in the Christmas season to raise her sales and improve her profits.  She makes a living in the sale of fruits and vegetables.  She will invest the loan in the purchase of apples, strawberries, grapes, pears, kiwis, and papaya.  

She says that her previous loan improved her sales and grew her income, thereby improving the quality of life for her family.  With the previous loan, she improved her savings, grew her inventory, and bought a stove and other electrical household appliances.

loans.use: to buy apples, strawberries, grapes, pears, kiwis, and papaya.

loans.name: Rene David

texts.es:
René, seguirá trabajando con la institución por la muestra de su mejoramiento en su negocio y la buena atención que se brinda, ha solicitado un crédito  para poder comprar insumos  agrícolas, preparará el terreno para la cosecha, compra de fertilizantes, semilla, abono y para pagar la mano de obra que le ayudara a realizar dicha producción
 Manifiesta que el crédito anterior fue muy positivo, el impacto en cuento  a su  producción ya que le permitió  lograr sembrar las dos manzanas  de maíz  y una pipianera la cual logro sacar el maíz y pago el crédito.
texts.en:
René will continue working with the institution; thanks to the demonstration of improvement in his business and the good service provided, he has requested a loan so that he can buy agricultural supplies. He will prepare the land for the harvest, buying fertilizers, seeds, and compost, and paying the laborers who will help him produce his crops. 

He reports that the previous loan was very positive in its impact on his production, since it permitted him to plant two fields of corn and one of squash, and he was able to harvest the corn and pay off the loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and compost, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua used the previous loan to buy rice and sugar to sell. He is a 33-year-old married man with three children, living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goal is to build a permanent house. He has been running a retail shop for the last three years and the major hardship is seasonal customers. However, he has a vision of diversifying his business to include motorcycle sales. Joshua intends to use the loan to buy soda and eggs to sell.

loans.use: to buy soda  and eggs to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for community health work

loans.name: Inti Raymi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “INTI RAYMI”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sonia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de papa y chuño, venta de comida, compra y venta de vacas, venta de moledoras, venta de cerveza.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias con distintos rubros, donde la señora Sonia es parte integrante, ella indica que hace cinco meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de promotora de la institución que fue a visitarla a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de papa, chuño y cerdo da a conocer que este negocio lo heredó de sus papás ya que siempre trabajaron en estos negocios.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de semilla de papa y cerditos pequeños) que adquirirá de las comunidades aledañas, por mayor,  y posteriormente al cultivo y a la crianza lo comercializará a pedido en la Ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros
texts.en:
The communal bank group, “INTI RAYMI” will start it's second cycle with Pro Mujer, as a part of the larger communal bank "Centro Focal de Achacachi". The group is made up of nine members and is led by a board of directors, a woman named Sonia is the president. The businesses that the group members are involved with are varied and include: selling potatoes and chuño (a freeze dried potato product), selling food, buying and reselling cows, selling grinding equipment, and selling beer.  

The loan that is being requested will benefit the small business owners who are members the communal bank group that Sonia is a part of with varied purchases. She said that she became a member of Pro Mujar five months ago, after a promoter of the organization visited her home and invited her to join. She currently has a business selling potatoes, chuño (a freeze dried potato product) and swine. She inherited this business from her parents and has always worked in this type of business. 

The loan she is currently requesting will be used to increase her capital to buy potato seeds and piglets, which she will buy in nearby communities for wholesale prices. After harvesting the potatoes and raising the piglets, she will sell them by pre-order in the city of El Alto. This form of work allows her to make an income which she uses to help with household expenses; she is married and has four children.   
 
When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the savings program.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and piglets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for community health work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for community health work

loans.name: Las Favoritas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS FAVORITAS”  iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Virginia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: corte de ladrillos, venta de estuco, venta de comida, venta de ropa, tienda de barrio, venta de sopa de fideo, venta de manstas, venta de chompas, macramé de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias con distintos rubros, donde la señora Virginia es parte integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida, cuenta que hace años tenía un negocio de venta de quesos posteriormente decide ingresar al negocio de la comida con la ayuda de una señora.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz y fideos por mayor) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el áre de salud.
texts.en:
The "Las Favoritas" communal bank will begin its seventh cycle with "Pro Mujer", through the Cascada regional office.  Made up of nine members, Las Favoritas group is directed by a board presided over by Virginia.  The members of this communal bank have various types of businesses, including: brick cutting, businesses selling plaster, food, clothes, noodle soups, jumpers and macrame blankets and grocery stores, 

This loan will benefit micro businesses in Virginia's group that are in different lines of work.  Virginia has said that she joined Pro Mujer two years, following an invitation from a friend who was a member of the bank.  Virginia currently has a business selling food.  She says that some years ago she had a cheese business but decided to start a foods business, with the help of another woman.

This loan will be used to increase stock (to buy rice and noodles in bulk) which will be bought in the shops of El Alto city and, following production, it will be sold in her sales outlet.

This type of work will allow her to generate an income to support her household.  She is married with four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Virginia responds that she likes the health area.

loans.use: to buy rice and noodles in bulk.

loans.name: Nelson Enrique

texts.es:
Nelson, vive con su Mamá, aprendió a hacer pan ya que su familia se dedicaba  a una tienda,  su estado civil es soltera y las personas que dependen de él es su Mama.
Manifiesta que recibió capacitación de panificación y como le fue bien en la venta, se dedico a hacerlo el cual se convirtió en una proveedora de las tiendas vecinas.
Está solicitando un crédito lo cual lo invertirá en la compra de mobiliario y equipo y materia prima para hacer el pan, la harina, manteca, levadura. 
El cual le ayudara para satisfacer la necesidad de los clientes  y ser un proveedor  de la zona, ya que existe una demanda bastante grande donde el reside. Nelson desea tener a futuro una panadería con diferentes tipos de pan, con un surtido grande al gusto del cliente.
texts.en:
Nelson lives with his mother.  Since his family makes a living at a shop, he learned to make bread.  He is single and his mother depends on him.

He says that he received training in bread-making and since his sales went well,  he began to work making bread and he became a supplier to the nearby shops.  

He is requesting a loan that he will invest in the purchase of furniture, equipment, and the raw materials he needs to make the bread, like flour, lard, and yeast.  These items will help him to satisfy the needs of his customers and to be a supplier to the entire area, since there is already a very large demand where he lives.  

Nelson hopes to have a bakery in the future, with different types of bread and a large assortment to suit his clients.

loans.use: to buy furniture, flour, lard, and yeast.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret used the previous loan to buy salt to sell. She is a 40-year-old single mother of four children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling salt for 15 years. Her hardships are seasonal weather, price fluctuations and inflation. Her personal goals are educating her children and building a permanent house for their residence. Her business goals are buying land to grow crops and expanding the business into new markets. Margret is requesting money to buy salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt to sell.

loans.name: Alaaedden

texts.en:
AlaaEdden is a 32-year-old, married man and a father to two sons and one daughter. He is a worker who gets a low salary which is not enough to cover all the family's needs.

AlaaEdden is building a new house to improve his family's living conditions, but the house's building process and its requirements are very expensive and he needs more and more money. The amount of money AlaaEdden has is not enough to complete all the work. 

He is requesting a USD 1,500 loan from Palestine for Credit and Development (FATEN) to cover the cost of purchasing necessary construction supplies, such as cement, wood, and iron, to complete building the house. This will speed the process of completing the building of the house and will enable AlaaEdden and his family to move into their new house soon and enjoy living in it. AlaaEdden is photographed in the location of his new house.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for a house.

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Luis, se decidió por renovar su crédito para la compra de materiales para la elaboración  de trabajos de albañilería y pesca,  mejorara el equipo de trabajo; los productos que él pretende comprar son cemento, hierro, hilos y gasolina para la pesca, entre otros.
El préstamo anterior dio resultaos positivos ya que su negocio en la albañilería ha seguido y tambien realizando pescas. La familia se ha mantenido  sus ingresos han mejorado; su deseo es que  su negocio se incremente para sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en: Luis decided to renew his loan in order to purchase more materials for his work as a mason and fisherman.  He will improve his work equipment.  The products he plans to purchase are cement, iron, ropes and gasoline for fishing, among other things.  His previous loan yielded positive results since both his masonry and fishing business have continued.  His family has been supported by his improved income.  His desire is that his business will grow so that his family can get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase cement, iron, ropes, and gasoline.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia is a 42-year-old, married woman with five children, living in Kasese, Uganda. For 15 years, she has been selling salt and, with the profits, she has been able to build rentals and pay school fees for her children. Her major dream is to process the salt, so as to add to the value and bargain for a better price. 

Scovia has a salt pan where she mines. She also buys from other miners to meet the high demand. The health hazards associated with salt mining pose a great challenge to her life and employees since she does not have protective gears. Scovia intends to use the loan to buy salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for community health work

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   Benkadi  est constitué de 4 femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur huitième prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de condiments,de céréales et des fruits et légumes. 
Raboua, qui est le membre du groupe papier en main, fait l’achat vente de condiments.  Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 5 cartons de concentrée de tomate, 40 litres d’huile alimentaires et 2 colis constitués de piments, fièfiè, poivre et sel, avec les grossistes de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Benkadi Group is made up of four married women who average 39 years of age and five children. Most of them live in traditional families in the Massablacoura neighborhood in the city of Bougouni. They met one another through neighborhood, friendship, and business ties.

To increase their financial means in order to better run their business, these women joined microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their eighth loan. This group of women is in business selling spices, cereals, fruit, and vegetables.

Raboua, who is the group member [pictured] holding some papers, purchases and sells condiments. With her loan, she plans to purchase from the wholesalers in Bamako five boxes of tomato concentrate, 40 liters of cooking oils, and two packages made up of hot peppers, fièfiè, pepper, and salt. She carries out her sales at the market and at home, at retail prices for cash and credit to a group of customers made up of men and women.

Raboua expects to see an average monthly profit of 35,000 CFA francs, which will be invested in the businesses and [used to] pay back the loan.

loans.use: To purchase condiments.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a fifty-year-old widow who has six children and lives in Kasese, Uganda. She has been operating a hardware shop for 14 years. With the hardware shop profits, she has been able to diversify her income sources by setting up a bar and venturing into the transport business. Like all good mothers, she desires to see all her children attain degrees, as a minimum qualification, and become employed in reputable organizations. Price fluctuations and high license fees hinder her business. Her dream is to trade in wholesale. Mary is requesting a loan to buy beverages, cement, oil and paints, to sell.

loans.use: to buy beverages, cement, oil and paints, to sell.

loans.name: Yosia

texts.en:
Yosia is a 72-year-old, married man with ten children, living in Kasese, Uganda. Fifty years ago, he decided to venture into the cattle trade. It is with the proceeds that he has been able to educate his children and buy land for farming. He started with local breeds and later bought exotic breeds which give him 50 liters of milk per day. He also sells off the old cows. Price fluctuations hinder his business, while his goal is to own a big ranch. 

Yosia intends to use the loan to buy cows to sell.

loans.use: to buy cows to sell.

loans.name: Ibraheem

texts.en:
Ibraheem is a 29-year-old young man. He is married and a father to one son and two daughters. Ibraheem is employed and gets a low salary which is not enough to cover all the family's needs.

Ibraheem wants to improve his family’s living conditions. He is requesting a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to complete the price of purchasing necessary home appliances such as a refrigerator, washing machine and oven.

Taking this loan will enable Ibraheem and his family to live in an easy way in their house and improve their living conditions.

Ibraheem is shown in the picture.


About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator, washing machine and oven for his house.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Danaya  est constitué de 4 femmes mariées et une veuve  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles nucléaires dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur deuxième  prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de condiments, d’habits, de savons et des fruits et légumes. 
Mah, qui est le membre du groupe papier en main, l’achat vente de condiments.  Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 5 sacs d’oignon, 1 carton de l’ail, et 1 colis de différentes sortes de condiments(aubergines, poivre, chou, feuilles de baobab et cube maggi) avec les grossistes de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Danaya Group is made up of four married women and one widow who average 34 years of age and five children. They live in nuclear families in the Massablacoura neighborhood in the city of Bougouni. They met one another through neighborhood, friendship, and business ties.

To increase their financial means in order to better run their business, these women joined microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their second loan. This group of women sells spices, clothing, soap, and fruit and vegetables.

Mah, who is the group member [pictured] holding some papers, buys and sells spices and vegetables. With her loan, she plans to purchase from the Bougouni wholesalers five bags of onions, one box of garlic, and one package of various vegetables (eggplant, pepper, cabbage, baobab leaves, and Maggi [bouillon] cubes). She carries out her sales at the market and at home, at retail prices for cash and credit to a group of customers made up of men and women.

Mah expects to see an average monthly profit of 30,000 CFA francs, which will be invested in the businesses and [used to] repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase spices and vegetables.

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   Sabali  est constitué de 4 femmes mariées et une veuve  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur onzième prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de condiments, de céréales et d’habits. 
Saran, qui est le membre du groupe  papier en main, fait l’achat vente de céréales  et compte acheter avec son  prêt, 1 tonne de maïs avec les producteurs des villages environnants de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group Sabali comprises four married women and one widow. They average 50 years of age and six children each and live for the most part in traditional families in the Massablacoura district in Bougouni City. They know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. To bolster their financial capacity, so as to work in commerce better, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their 11th loan.  This group of women does commerce in condiments, grains, and clothing. 

Saran, who is the group member with papers in hand in the photo, buys and sells grains. She intends to use her loan to purchase 1 tonne of corn from producers from the villages surrounding Bougouni. She makes her sales at the market and at home at the retail level. Accepting cash or credit, she sells to a customer base composed of men and women. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA that will be used to invest in her business and to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Zilse

texts.es: Colonias, suéteres, interiores, papelería, sabanas y muchas otras mercancias, fue lo que compró Zilse con su previo credikiva; ella se siente muy felíz porque aumentó su capital de trabajo y hoy por eso está aplicando a un nuev financiamiento con Kiva, pues se acerca la nochebuena y el final de año, temporada en la cual las ventas se incrementan por cuenta de sus clientes consumidores, que tienen mucho dinero circulante y capacidad de compra. Su credikiva tendrá éxito lo invertirá en ropa, perfumeria y fantasia femenina, porque lo invertirá en una temporada de alta demanda y sobre los pedidos de sus mejores clientes que finalmente le permtiran ganar mcuho mas y aportarle a l desarrollo de su familia.
texts.en:
Colognes, sweaters, undergarments, stationery, bed sheets, and other types of merchandise are what Zilse bought with her previous Kiva loan. She is very happy because she was able to increase her operating capital. Now she is applying for a new Kiva loan since Christmas Eve and the end of the year are when her sales increase. Her customers have much more money and greater spending capacity during this time.

Zilse will successfully invest this Kiva loan in clothing, perfume, and women’s costume jewelry for the high demand season. By fulfilling the orders from her best customers, she will finally be able to earn more and contribute to the development of her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfume, and women’s costume jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and beer, for resale in his shop.

loans.name: El Buen Pastor Group

texts.es: El banco comunal el Buen pastor está conformado por ocho integrantes, siete mujeres, y un hombre. Todos mayores de edad, responsables de 10 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ellos son originarios del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Lugar que se caracteriza por ser productivo en los derivados de la leche, cuajada, crema. Los integrantes del banco son personas de la misma comunidad la cual decidieron unirse para obtener el beneficio del desembolso en forma grupal ya que se conocen y se apoyan mutuamente en sus diferentes actividades económicas. Gloria es la coordinadora del banco la cual se encarga de la responsabilidad de los pagos en tiempo y forma. Ella tiene por actividad económica la venta de leche, cuajada crema de forma ambulante, y en su casa de habitación.  Gloria trabaja unas 10 horas aproximadamente ofreciendo sus cuajas a en su comunidad y en las aledañas, cargado una pana de unos 15 kg para ofrecer su producto diariamente. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y poder comprar más cuajada para aumentar sus ingresos y satisfacer a  sus clientes.  El banco comunal el Buen Pastor agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank El Buen Pastor (The Good Shepherd) is made up of eight members, seven women and one man. All are over the age of 18, and they are responsible for ten children. They are from Sauce, located in the northern part of the country. It is known for producing milk products, curds, and cream. The bank members are people from the same community who decided to join together to reap the benefits of a loan as a group, since they know each other and support each other in their different economic activities.

Gloria is the coordinator for the bank, and is responsible for the time and manner of payments. She sells milk, cuajada (milk curd), and cream as a street vendor, and from her home. She works about 10 hours a day, selling curds in her community and in the surrounding areas, loading a basket with 15kg to sell her product daily. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and be able to buy more curds to increase her income and satisfy her customers. El Buen Pastor communal bank thanks the Kiva lenders who help people with few resources from poor countries like Nicaragua to have a dignified way to make a living.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to buy and sell milk, cuajada (milk curds), and cream.

loans.name: Jorge De Jesus

texts.es:
Jorge, está iniciando la labor de recolección de cosecha, para esto necesita solicitar un nuevo préstamo que le permita pagar una maquina desgranadora y tambien alquilara tres manzanas de terreno para iniciar el nuevo año con la siembra de la temporada.
Este préstamo ayudara que Jorge tenga la cosecha procesada para poder consumirla y tambien adelanta su trabajo en el cultivo de la nueva temporada, él comenta que su capacidad ha mejorado en la agricultura.
texts.en:
Jorge is beginning to collect his harvest so he needs a new loan that will allow him to pay for a degraining machine and rent three plots of land to begin the new season of planting.

This loan will help Jorge have a good harvest so he can eat and also allows him to get a head start on the next season.  He says that his farming capabilities have improved.

loans.use: to begin his next season.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar, who was photographed next to some gas canisters he has, is a 22-year-old, single man. Omar lives with his family, in a modest house in a small village. For the past five years, Omar has had his project, selling and distributing gas canisters to customers in his village. He is well-known in his village and has a lot of loyal customers, which makes his project a profitable one. It is the only source of income to him, but now it needs more support to cover some costs.

Omar is requesting a US Dollar youth loan from FATEN, to cover the cost of purchasing additional gas canisters. Taking this loan will increase sales and improve Omar's project, increasing his income, which will ensure to him a better future.

loans.use: To purchase more gas canisters, to distribute and sell

loans.name: Gulsaana

texts.ru: Гулсаана 54 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей.Все дети у заемщицы взрослые, лишь одна младшая дочка, учится в школе.  У Гульсааны есть  внук, ему 2 годика.По характеру человек очень хороший, спокойный и очень оптимистичный. Благодаря стараниям и трудолюбию Гулсаана её бизнес имеет хороший потенциал. Она занимается откормом с последующей реализацией скота, паралельно она занимается полеводством, ежегодно обрабатывает 1,50 га земли. Так как основной культурой данной области является фасоль, Гулсаана тоже сажает данные вид культуры и многолетние травы. Начав этот бизнес в 1995 году с 10,000 KGS сейчас у неё имеется 10 голов овец, 2 лошади, 2 коровы и и 2 бычка. Ежемесячный доход Гулсаана составляет 10,000 KGS Сом. Она обратилась в "Бай Тушум и Партнеры" за кредитом в размере 60,000 KGS сом. На полученные средства она собирается закупить  овцематок, для последующего увеличения скота.Гулсаана поделилась с нами что хочет осуществить давнюю мечту, купить авто.
texts.en: Gulsaana is 54 years old and married with five children.  All of her children are grown except her youngest daughter who is still in school.  Gulsaana has a grandson who is two years old.  She is a good, peaceful and optimistic person.  Thanks to her efforts and diligence, Gulsaana's business has good potential.  She raises livestock for resale and she is also involved in agriculture, working 1.5 hectares of land annually.  Since the main crop of the area is beans, Gulsaana grows them as well as perennial grasses.  Having started her business in 1995 with 10,000 KGS, she now has ten head of sheep, two horses, two cows and two bulls.  Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS).  She has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS).  On receiving her loan, she plans to purchase ewes so she can increase the size of her herd.  Gulsaana told us that she wants to fulfill an old dream, which is to purchase a car.

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Juzumkan

texts.ru: Жузумкан 59 лет, вдова,мать 2 детей. Сыновья Жузумкан взрослые, один сын помогает ей в ведении хозяйства.  За период оформления кредита Жузумкан показала себя как человек ответственные, порядочный, добросовестный, предприимчивый и с чувством долга умеющий правильно вести и вкладывать денежные средства в нужное направление. Жузумкан в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 1982 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 500 рублей. Благодаря упорному труду Жузумкан, ее деятельность приносит около 10,000 KGS в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Жузумкан имеет очень развитое хозяйство, в хозяйстве имеется 3 коровы, 2 нетели,25 коз и 2 овцы.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жузумкан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков и овец. Доходы от кредита Жузумкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, в этом году весной она планирует женить младшего сына.
texts.en:
Juzumkan is 59 years old, a widow, and the mother of two children.  Juzumkan's sons are both adults and one of them helps with running the business.  Over the course of preparing her loan, Juzumkan showed herself to be a responsible, scrupulous, conscientious, and enterprising person, with a sense of duty and knowledgable in managing her financial resources and in investing them in the right things.  Juzumkan has been in the animal husbandry business since 1982 and it has been the main source of income for the family.  She began the business with 500 rubles.  As a result of her hard work, her business brings in about 10,000 KGS per month, which serves as the basis for covering food expenses and the family's other household needs.  

Juzumkan's business is very highly developed and she has three cows, two heifers, 25 goats, and two sheep.  With an aim to further developing her business, Juzumkan applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy bulls and sheep.  Juzumkan plans to invest the profit from the loan in further growing her business and she is planning to marry off her youngest son in the spring.

loans.use: to purchase bulls and sheep

loans.name: Edelmira De Los Angeles

texts.es: Edelmira  de los ángeles de 26 años de edad, soltera con tres hijos menores de edad 9,8 Y 2 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en primaria, ella  se dedica a la  venta de mercadería en general como (venta de ropa de niños, adultos, chinerías, prendas cosméticos y otros ), su negocio lo tiene desde hace 10 años, su forma de distribución es ambulante en centro de trabajos y otros comerciantes, ella da crédito y lo recupera semanal y quincenal actualmente ha podido salir adelante Edelmira tiene un buen comportamiento de pago, ella compra en Managua, está solicitando financiamiento para invertir en capital de trabajo para así ofrecerle gran variedad de mercadería a sus cliente, ya que gracias a que siempre esta abasteciendo con la compra de nueva mercadería y de acorde a la temporada, sus clientela ha ido creciendo teniendo mayor demanda.
texts.en: Edelmira  de los Angeles, 26, is single with three children, ages 9, 8, and 2. The two oldest are in elementary school. She works selling general merchandise like clothing for children and adults, knick-knacks, garments, cosmetics, etc. She has had her business for ten years. She sells as a street vendor near work centers and other sellers. She sells on credit and gets payments weekly and bi-weekly. She has been able to advance and she has a good payment history. She buys in Managua. She is applying for a loan to invest in working capital so that she can offer her customers a large variety of merchandise. Her customer base has been growing and she has had greater demand, thanks to the fact that she is always stocking up with new and season-appropriate merchandise.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise, especially children's clothing, knick-knacks, garments, cosmetics, clothing for adults, and other products.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Manuel  tambien arrienda apartamentos y locales comerciales y ofrece  el servicio de telefonía celular.  Manuel ha recibido 3 financiamientos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con los cuales ha logrado hacer crecer su negocio en capital de trabajo y adicional el negocio de venta de minutos a celulares, en 3 puntos de ventas diferentes. Su deseo de prosperidad no cesa por eso está acudiendo a su credikiva, para comprar materiales de construcción y hacer mejoramientos locativos demás de comprar celulares, con el fin de aumentar el servicio. Con su credikiva una vez más, aumentará las posibilidades de crecimiento y mejoramiento locativo, ofreciendo a sus arrendatarios , una imagen de mayor calidad de los servicios que ofrece y esto es justamente el éxito de su inversión.
texts.en:
Manuel also rents out apartments and commercial spaces and offers cellular phone service.  Manuel has received 3 loans from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he has been able to grow his business in working capital and also his business of selling cell phone minutes, at 3 different points of sale.  

His desire for prosperity does not let up, which is why he is turning to his Kiva loan to buy construction materials and to make renovations, in addition to buying cell phones, with an eye to increasing service.  With another Kiva loan, he increases his possibilities of growth and renovations, offering his tenants a better impression of the quality of services that he offers.  This is precisely the success of his investment.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and to make renovations in addition to buying cellular phones

loans.name: Jose Arturo

texts.es:
José, necesita invertir nuevamente en la recolección de granos básicos, por eso solicita un préstamo que le ayude a cubrir los gastos de pago de una maquina desgranadora y pagara tambien la mano de obra para realizar el proceso.
Él manifiesta que los prestamos le ayudan a realizar el trabajo en la agricultura, él dinero que obtiene como ganancias le sirve para mejorar el la condición familiar, hasta el momento no ha enfrentado ninguna situación y esta agradecido por los créditos Kiva.
texts.en:
José needs to invest in harvesting basic grains again. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to help him cover the costs of payments for a destemming machine, and for workers to carry out this process.

He says that the loans help him to complete his agricultural work. The money he earns as income helps him to improve his family's condition. Until now, he has not faced any problems and he is grateful for the Kiva loans.

loans.use: to pay for a destemming machine and workers.

loans.name: Gulkaiyr

texts.ru: Гулкайыр проживает в пгт. Каинда на севере  столицы Кыргызстана Бишкека со своей семьей с тремя детьми, младшей из которых семь лет. Как и многие семьи в сельской местности, Гулкайыр с мужем откармливают скот, начав этот бизнес в 1998 году. На сегодняшний день, Гулкайыр в своем хозяйстве имеет 1 дойную корову, 23 овец. Продажа молока, молочных продуктов и мяса позволяет получать около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Гулкайыр обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы Гулкайыр планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, в будущем она мечтает приобрести авто.
texts.en:
Gulkaiyr and her family live in the village of Kaindy to the north of the Kyrgyz capital Bishkek. She has three children, the youngest of whom is seven. Like many other families in rural areas, Gulkaiyr and her husband raise livestock, having started their business in 1998. Presently, Gulkaiyr keeps 1 dairy cow and 23 sheep. Sales of milk, dairy products and meat allow her to earn around 15,000 som (KGS) per month.

In order to continue expanding her business, Gulkaiyr has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase calves for fattening and resale. She plans to re-invest her additional profits into her business by further increasing the size of her herd, and dreams of buying a car in the future.

loans.use: calves for fattening and resale

loans.name: Burobiya

texts.ru: Буробия 44 года, замужем, воспитала пятерых детей. Буробия 12 лет назад начала свой бизнес в животноводстве. Начатое с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство купив 1 корову, сегодня приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных продуктов и перепродажи скота.На сегодня в хозяйстве имеется 2 коровы. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Буробия обратилась в компанию «Бай Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят и и молодых овец. Доходы от кредита Буробия планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашние скотины, и в ближайшем будущем – улучшить содержание скота.
texts.en: Burobiya is 44 years old, married, and has raised five children. Burobiya started working in animal husbandry twelve years ago. She started with 10,000 som (KGS) and bought one cow. Today, her farm brings in about 10,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of dairy products and the resale of cattle.  Today, the farm has two cows. In order to further increase her livestock, Burobiya contacted Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase calves and sheep. Burobiya plans to invest her profits to increase the number of domestic animals she has and, in the near future, to improve the livestock's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves and lambs.

loans.name: Saparkul

texts.ru: Сапаргул 49 года, вдова. Образование среднее занимается торговлей риса на центральном рынке города Узген. Мать 5 детей.  Ей цель жизни, это улучшить жизненные условия, обучить детей в хорошем университете и конечно же расширить бизнес. Сапаргул очень добрая, общительная, умная и шустрая. Сапаргул начала свой бизнес 13 лет назад начальная сумма вклада составляла 2,500 KGS. По мимио торговле она активно занимается животноводством. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Сапаргул имеется 4 голов КРС. В целях дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товарооборота за счет покупки риса. На доход полученный от кредита она будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Saparkul is a 49-year-old widow with a high school education. She works selling rice at the central market in the city of Uzgen. She is the mother of 5 children. Her goal in life is to improve her standard of living, to give her children a good university education, and to of course expand her business. She is very kind, sociable, smart, and energetic. She started her business 13 years ago with a start-up sum of only 2,500 Kyrgyzstan Som (KGS.) Besides working in retail, she is also actively involved in animal husbandry. Her farm currently includes 4 head of cattle. For the purpose of expanding her business, Saparkul has approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 Som which will help her to increase her turnover by buying more rice. She plans to use the income generated by this loan to re-invest into her business for further development.

loans.use: To purchase more rice for resale

loans.name: Bermethan

texts.ru: Берметхан 50 лет, вдова, воспитала 1 сына. Берметхан  после развала СССР Получила свой участок земли и с  1992 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 50,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Берметхан имеется 2 дойные коровы и 20 голов овец. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 11,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Доходы позволили Берметхан создать необходимую базу для сына для создания  собственной семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Берметхан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения хозяйства и доходы от бизнеса. Доходы Берметхан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Bermethan is 50 years old and a widow.  She raised one son.  After the collapse of the USSR, Bermethan received her own plot of land where, since 1992, she has been in the business of animal husbandry and farming.  She began her business with 50,000 som (KGS), and today she has two milk cows and 20 sheep, with a monthly income of about 11,000 som (KGS).  This income has allowed Bermethan to lay the necessary foundation for her son to have his own family.  

With an aim to further developing her business, Bermethan applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to enlarge her business and increase the income it brings in.  Bermethan plans to invest the profits from the loan in further enlarging her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Mira

texts.ru: Мире 29 лет, замужем, воспитала 4 детей. В 2001 году, в поисках дохода для своей семьи, Мира начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 3,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Миры на сегодняшний день имеется 2 дойные коровы, 3 головы Кобылы и 6 головы овец. Доходы от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов составляют примерно 6,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Мира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на закуп дополнительных голов скота. Доходы от кредита Мира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Mira is 29 years old and married with four children.  In search of a way to earn an income for her family, Mira got into the business of raising livestock and farming with a starting capital of 3,000 som (KGS).  Today she has two milk cows, three mares, and six head of sheep.  Her income from the sale of dairy and meat products comes to about 6,000 som (KGS) per month.

With an aim to further developing her business, Mira applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy additional cattle.  Mira plans to invest the profits from the loan in further increasing the size of her business.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Pedro,  está solicitando otro préstamo ya que necesita invertir en mano de obra para recolectar doce tareas de maicillo y el resto lo utilizara para el mantenimiento de una vaca y su cría.
Manifiesta que el crédito anterior  le ayudo mucho en su situación económica, con la inversión del crédito logro sacar una cosecha abundante de maíz y frijol, lo cual lo comercializo y obtuvo resultados mucho más favorables que en créditos anteriores. Han cambiado algunas circunstancias de su vida, gracias al esfuerzo personal y al crédito otorgado por KIVA sus condiciones para su negocio son mejores que cuando empezó a trabajar y cuenta también que las condiciones familiares y personales ahora son mejores,  así cuenta con una mejor confianza de invertir en su negocio.
texts.en: Pedro is applying for another loan because he needs to pay workers to gather twelve hectares of sorghum. He will use the rest to maintain a cow and her offspring. He says that the previous loan helped his economic situation a lot. With the investment of the loan, he was able to collect an abundant harvest of corn and beans, which he sold and got much better results than he had gotten with previous loans. They have changed some circumstances in his life. Thanks to his effort and and the Kiva loan, his business conditions are better than when he started to work. He also says that his family and personal situations are now better. He has more confidence investing in his business.

loans.use: to pay workers to gather the harvest.

loans.name: Hafez

texts.en:
Hafez is a 27-year-old, married man with no children yet. Hafez lives with his wife in a small village and he has a good reputation amongst his relatives and friends. Hafez is an ambitious young man and he prepares to start his own business which is a mobile phone store. 

Hafez has an amount of money which is not enough to cover all the costs. He is requesting a USD Murabaha loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN) to cover the cost of purchasing the necessary number of mobile phones to open his store and meet the demand of his customers. Taking this loan will enable Hafez to successfully start his business and ensure better income and a bright future. Hafez is photographed inside his modest store.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phones to sell.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en: Geofrey is a thirty year old living in Kasese, Uganda. He is a very hard-working man who is involved in a number of businesses, which include a retail business and salt pans, he also has a boat for a transport business. Bad weather and insufficient capital to meet demand are his challenges, while his dreams are to own a wholesale shop and buy an automatic boat with a big engine as he currently owns a wooden boat. Geofrey intends to use the loan to buy salt, soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt, soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Wesam

texts.en:
Wesam is a 37-year-old married man. He lives in Rafah city with his wife and two sons. He is a worker with a low income that does not cover all of the family's needs. Wesam would like to buy a water filter for his home to be sure that the water the family uses is clean and drinkable. 

Wesam is requesting a $700 USD loan from FATEN to help him to buy the water filter for his home. Wesam appears in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a water filter for his home

loans.name: Ainura

texts.ru: Айнура – родилась в 1970 году, в селе Ак-Тектир, Токтогульского района, в семье простых рабочих. В 1988 году окончила среднюю школу  им.Жаманкулова, с. Ак-Тектир. Свою трудовую деятельность начала с 1989 года, работала в Центре Семейной Медицины, санитаркой. В 1989 году вышла замуж в с.Ак-Тектир, Токтогульского района. В  данное  время заемщица занимается животноводством, сейчас в хозяйстве имеет 2 коровы, 1 теленка.  Айнура мать 4 детей,имеет 2-х сыновей и 2-х  дочерей.По хозяйству помогают супруг и  сыновья.Трудовую деятельность в сфере животноводства начала с 1995 года, был закуплен 2 голов МРС. Для расширения своего хозяйства Айнура обратилась в банк "Бай Тушум и партнеры" для получения кредита в сумме 65,000 KGS. В будущем хочет построить большой дом  на участке своего дома, расширить свое хозяйство и улучшить свое материальное состояние.
texts.en:
Ainura was born in 1970 in the village of Aktektir in the Toktogulskii region, to a family of manual laborers.  In 1988, she graduated from the village high school named after Djamkulov.  She began her working life in 1989 as an aide in the Center for Family Medicine.  She married in 1989 in her village.  She has four children:  two sons and two daughters.  

Currently, she is in the animal husbandry business and she has two cows and one calf.  She began the business in 1995 with the purchase of two head of sheep.  Her husband and sons help her with the business.  In order to expand her business, Ainura applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 65,000 KGS.  In the future, she wants to build a large house on her piece of land, expand her business, and to improve her financial position.

loans.use: to purchase calves and young sheep

loans.name: Kulsunai

texts.ru: Кулсунай 56 лет, замужем, имеет 2 детей. В качестве основного дохода с 1992 года Кулсунай занимается оказанием населению швейных услуг,также шьет одежды, национальные изделия. Начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы в 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Кулсунай, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 100,000 KGS в обороте и швейное оборудование  на сумму 50,000 KGS, у нее работает одна наемная работница, прибыль от швейного бизнеса составляет 15,000 KGS  в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кулсунай обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку материалов, что позволит увеличить обороты. Доходы от кредита Кулсунай планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса. Планирует нанять еще 2 наемных рабочих. В будущем планирует сделать дома ремонт.
texts.en:
Kulsunai is 56 years old, married, and has two children.  Since 1992, her main source of income has been providing the public with sewing services such as making clothes and traditional handiwork.  She started her business with a capital of 20,000 som (KGS) and, as a result of her hard work, today she has 100,000 som (KGS) worth of inventory and 50,000 KGS worth of sewing equipment.  She has one employee and her monthly profit from the sewing business comes to 15,000 KGS.  

With an aim to further developing her business, Kulsunai applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 130,000 som (KGS) to buy material to enable to enlarge her turnover.  Kulsunai plans to invest the profits from the loan in further expanding her business.  She plans to hire two more employees.  She plans to do home repairs in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for clothes production

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis, por la temporada de fin de año, está solicitando un préstamo para darle continuidad al negocio, se comprara tomares, cebollas, repollo, maíz y chicharrón, que son los necesarios para realizar la venta, esto le dará a Luis mas capacidad ayudando a su esposa en la venta.
Él manifiesta que el trabajo con los créditos le ha permitido estabilizar su situación económica, aumentar la clientela con el buen servicio, en su hogar sus circunstancias han mejorado.
texts.en:
Luis, at the end of this year, is requesting a loan to continue his business. He will buy tomatoes, onions, cabbage, corn and pork. These are necessary to carry out his business. This will give Luis the ability to help his wife with the sale of goods.

He said that working with the loans has permitted him to stabilize his economic situation, grow his clientele with good service, and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, cabbage, corn and pork.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en: Madina is mother of 3 children. She was born in 1963. This woman lives in the Agjabadi region. She buys hazelnuts from the villages and prepares the kernel of the nuts at her home to sell. Madina has run this business for 10 years, to support her family. Now she needs a loan of 1000 AZN to buy hazelnuts to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy hazelnuts.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 24-year-old, single man. He is a worker and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover all his needs. Ahmad is an ambitious, young man and he has a good reputation amongst his relatives and friends. He is looking to have his own business and depend more on himself to gain better income. Ahmad wants to prepare to have the necessary equipment to start his business which is making for customers traditional Palestinian dishes and sandwiches, such as Homos dishes and Shawarma sandwiches.

Ahmad is requesting a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN) to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new machine to grill meat in order to prepare Shawarma sandwiches. He will also purchase a new blender to make Homos dishes from chickpeas. 

Taking this loan will help Ahmad to successfully start his business and ensure to him a bright future and better income. Ahmad is photographed next to the grill machine for Shawarma that he is making for customers.

loans.use: to buy for his business a new machine to grill meat and to purchase a new blender.

loans.name: Hamid

texts.en:
Hamid is married and has four children. He is a hardworking person. Hamid lives in the Fizuli region of Azerbaijan with his wife and children, but he was an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fizuli town. 

This is his second loan. He was very thankful to Kiva lenders for the first loan. Hamid has changed his business now. He had a general store, but now he has started to sell wheat, flour, grain, etc., wholesale.
 
Now Hamid needs 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) to buy new products for sale to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy new products for sale.

loans.name: Tahir

texts.ru:
Tahir is married and has 4  children. Tahir loves his family and spending time with them.  He is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fizuli city, but now lives and works in Absheron region with his family. Tahir needs 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to make repairs in his car. He has been in this taxi business for 2 years. He need to increase his monthly income to keep his family.

It was his second loan on Kiva. He was very thankful to Kiva and lenders for help him.
texts.en:
Tahir is married and has 4  children. Tahir loves his family and spending time with them.  He is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fizuli city, but now lives and works in Absheron region with his family. Tahir needs 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to make repairs in his cafe. He has been in this taxi business for 2 years. He need to increase his monthly income to keep his family.

It was his second loan on Kiva. He was very thankful to Kiva and lenders for help him.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   Sabougnouma  est constitué de 5 femmes  mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles adhérent à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur premier  prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de condiments, de céréales, d’habits et des fruits et légumes. 
Mariam, qui est le membre du groupe papier en main, fait l’achat vente de céréales.  Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 3 sacs de 100kg de maïs et 1 sac de 100kg de fonio avec les grossistes de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Sabougnouma Group is made up of five married women who average 30 years of age and four children. Most of them live in traditional families in the Massablacoura neighborhood in the city of Bougouni. They met through neighborhood, friendship, and business ties.

To increase their financial means in order to better run their business, these women belong to microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their first loan. This group of women sells spices, cereals, clothing, and fruit and vegetables.

Mariam, who is the group member [pictured] holding some papers, buys and sells cereals. With her loan, she plans to purchase three 100kg sacks of corn and one 100kg sack of fonio from the Bougouni wholesalers. She carries out her sales at the market and at home, at retail prices for cash and credit to a group of customers made up of men and women.

Mariam expects to see an average monthly profit of 20,000 CFA francs, which will be invested in the businesses and [used to] repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase cereals.
